TEXT.English: Victory - Tower of Mastery
TEXT.French: Victoire - Tour de Maîtrise
TEXT.Italian: Victory - Tower of Mastery
TEXT.Spanish: Victoria - Torre de la Maestría

TEXT.English: [H1]Victory - Tower of Mastery[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]This victory condition requires that the player first build the four lesser towers; the Tower of Alteration, Tower of Divination, Tower of Necromancy and the Tower of the Elements. Each of these towers require multiple mana types to be built and all the games mana types must be controlled to build all of them. Once they are all built the player can begin building the Tower of Master. If that is completed the player wins the game.[PARAGRAPH:2]Kael's Notes- This victory condition is a homage to the amazing Master of Magic game. When it was initially added it was nearly impossible to achieve without practically winning a domination victory first, and even then it was only possible on the largest map sizes. The plan was always to introduce more ways to get the mana required to create the lesser towers rather than to make the victory condition easier and with the introduction of Vassals (or more importantly the access that gives to their palace mana) we achieved that goal. Making this a reasonable victory condition that can be achieved through expansion, conquest or diplomacy (or, most effectively, a combination of the three).
TEXT.French: [H1]Victoire - Tour de Maîtrise[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Cette condition de victoire impose d'abord au joueur de construire les quatre tours mineures; la Tour d'Altération, la Tour de Divination, ve Nécromancie et la Tour des Eléments. Chacune d'entre elles a besoin de plusieurs types de mana pour être construites et tous les types de mana du jeu doivent être controlés pour pouvoir toutes les construire. Un fois qu'elles sont toutes contruites le joueur peut alors construire la Tour de Maîtrise. Si celle ci est terminée le joueur gagne la partie.[PARAGRAPH:2]Note de Kael- Cette condition de victoire est un hommage au fameux jeu Master of Magic. Lorsqu'elle a d'abord été ajoutée, il était presque impossible de la construire sans obtenir d'abord une victoire par domination , et encore seulement sur les plus grandes cartes . Le but a toujours été d'ajouter des méthodes pour obtenir les divers types de mana requis pour la construction des tours plutôt que de faciliter la condition de victoire et avec l'introduction des Vassaux( ou plus important à l'accès qu'ils offrent au mana de leur palais), nous avons atteint ce but. C'est une condition de victoire raisonnable qui peut être atteinte à la fois par l'expansion, la conquête ou la diplomatie.
TEXT.German: [H1]Siegvariante - Turm der Macht[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Diese Siegbedingung erfordert das Errichten der vier niederen Türme: Turm der Alteration, Turm der Weissagung, Turm der Nekromantie und Turm der Elemente. Jeder dieser Türme erfordert verschiedene Arten von Mana und um alle vier zu bauen benötigt man die Kontrolle über alle Typen von Mana. Wurden alle vier Türme errichtet kann der Spieler mit dem Bau an dem Turm der Macht beginnen. Ist der Bau vollendet gewinnt der Spieler das Spiel.[PARAGRAPH:2]Kael's Notiz: Diese Sigbedingung ist eine Anlehnung an das fantastische Spiel Master of Magic. Zu Beginn war es praktisch unmöglich den Turm der Macht zu errichten ohne vorher einen Sieg der Domination zu erlangen und selbst dann war es nur auf den grössten Karten möglich. Es war der Plan mehrere Wege zu ermöglichen an die gesamten Arten von Mana zu kommen, um die vier niederen Türme zu bauen, ohne die Siegbedingungen zu vereinfachen. Dies gelingt mit der Einführung der Vasallen (insbesondere durch Zugang ihrer Mana, die sie durch ihren Palast erhalten). Dies macht die Siegbedingung des Turmes der Macht zu einer Siegvariante, die durch Expansion, Eroberung und Diplomatie (oder einer Kombination mehrerer) erreicht werden kann.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]Victory - Tower of Mastery[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]This victory condition requires that the player first build the four lesser towers; the Tower of Alteration, Tower of Divination, Tower of Necromancy and the Tower of the Elements. Each of these towers require multiple mana types to be built and all the games mana types must be controlled to build all of them. Once they are all built the player can begin building the Tower of Master. If that is completed the player wins the game.[PARAGRAPH:2]Kael's Notes- This victory condition is a homage to the amazing Master of Magic game. When it was initially added it was nearly impossible to achieve without practically winning a domination victory first, and even then it was only possible on the largest map sizes. The plan was always to introduce more ways to get the mana required to create the lesser towers rather than to make the victory condition easier and with the introduction of Vassals (or more importantly the access that gives to their palace mana) we achieved that goal. Making this a reasonable victory condition that can be achieved through expansion, conquest or diplomacy (or, most effectively, a combination of the three).
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]Victoria - Torre de la Maestría[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Esta condición de victoria requiere que el jugador construya primero las cuatro torres menores; la Torre de Alteración, la Torre de la Adivinación, la Torre de la Nigromancia y la Torre de los Elementos. Cada una de estas torres requieren múltiples tipos de maná para ser construidas y todos los tipos de maná del juego son los que hay que controlar para construir todas ellas. Una vez construidas el jugador puede empezar a construir la Torre de la Maestría. Si es completada, el jugador gana el juego.[PARAGRAPH:2]Notas de Kael: Esta condición de victoria está basada en el juego Master of Magic. Inicialmente, cuando la añadimos era prácticamente imposible de conseguir sin ganar primero por dominación, e incluso entonces sólo era posible en los mapas de tamaño más grande. El plan siempre fue introducir más formas de conseguir el maná requerido para crear las torres menores en lugar de hacer la condición de victoria más fácil y con la introducción de los Vasales (o más importante el acceso que da su palacio de maná) logramos ese objetivo. Haciendola como una condición de victoria razonable que puede alcanzarse sin la expansión, la conquista o la diplomacia (o, más correctamente, una combinación de las tres).

TEXT.English: Weapon Upgrades
TEXT.French: Améliorations des Armes
TEXT.Italian: Weapon Upgrades
TEXT.Spanish: Mejoras de Armas

TEXT.English: [H1]Weapon Upgrades[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Some units can have their strength upgraded by certain weapon types. Units capable of using [LINK=PROMOTION_BRONZE_WEAPONS]Bronze weapons[\LINK] get +1 strength if you have access to [LINK=BONUS_COPPER]copper[\LINK]. Units capable of using [LINK=PROMOTION_IRON_WEAPONS]Iron weapons[\LINK] get +2 strength if you have access to [LINK=BONUS_IRON]iron[\LINK] and units capable of using [LINK=PROMOTION_MITHRIL_WEAPONS]Mithril weapons[\LINK] get +4 strength if you have access to [LINK=BONUS_MITHRIL]mithril[\LINK]. Multiple weapon types aren't cumulative (a unit can't have both iron and mithril weapons) and units have to enter one of your cities to upgrade their weapons.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Note that getting access to copper requires the [LINK=TECH_BRONZE_WORKING]Bronze Working[\LINK] tech (even though it is revealed with Mining). Getting access to Iron requires the [LINK=TECH_IRON_WORKING]Iron Working[\LINK] tech (though it is revealed with Smelting) and getting access to Mithril requires the [LINK=TECH_MITHRIL_WORKING]Mithril Working[\LINK] tech.

TEXT.English: Werewolves
TEXT.French: Loup-Garous
TEXT.Italian: Werewolves
TEXT.Spanish: Hombres-lobo

TEXT.English: [H1]Werewolves[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]The Werewolves of Erebus have slipped into legend since the death of Baron Duin Halfmorn, but rumors also mention a small village in which they may still clutch to existence. Should these rumors prove true, or the Baron be brought back from the grave, they may sweep across the land once more.[PARAGRAPH:1]Werewolves can be found in wild lairs on occasion, locked in their natural form and as mindless as any other animal, but units killed by a Werewolf have a chance of being reborn under the control of their former enemy and infected with the curse of the Wolf. The unit will initially be weakened and suffer from an insatiable lust for violence. This may lead to occasional periods of rebellion, and continues until the Wolfling has regained their former strength. After that the unit is typically able to contain the wilder impulses, and begins to grow more powerful through the effects of the curse.

TEXT.English: What is Fall from Heaven?
TEXT.French: Qu'est ce que Fall From Heaven?
TEXT.Italian: What is Fall from Heaven?
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Qué es Fall from Heaven?

TEXT.English: [H1]What is Fall from Heaven?[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Based on a long running Dungeons and Dragons campaign Fall from Heaven is set in the dark fantasy world of Erebus. This is a world where the themes of corruption and redemption are repeated and all the characters, including the gods themselves, are imperfect.[PARAGRAPH:2]Although the mod isn't a direct translation of any of the following inspiration comes from Celtic and Norse mythology, Judeo-Christian mysticism and the works of Edgar Allen Poe and H.P. Lovecraft.[PARAGRAPH:2]Kael's Notes: The goal of this mod is to provide a turn based strategy game with a focus on replayability. I am a huge fan of the Civilization series but after playing a dozen or so games they began to feel the same. That's actually a pretty amazing feat, what other game can you beat a dozen times before it starts to feel the same?[PARAGRAPH:2]We pursued our replayability goal by making a few key decisions:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]1.[TAB]Each civilization should be fundamentally different than any other. Much more than just a different Unique Unit and Unique Building we want the player to have to adapt to different strategies and play styles to play each civ. We understood that not all players would like all civs, but each would find some that appealed to their play style and players in for a new experience could try something that played differently than they were used to.[NEWLINE]2.[TAB]A players state religion should have a dramatic effect on his civilization. As such there are really 7 versions of each civilization, that civilization with each religion.[NEWLINE]3.[TAB]A general dislike for patterns. Although easy to design and balance patterns are generally uncreative. Instead we craft each option individually and try to balance overall rather than on the specific option being created.[PARAGRAPH:2]Overall this means that FfH has a higher learning curve than most games, all of these options come at a cost. But once learned our hope is that there is game deep enough for players to enjoy for months or years.
TEXT.French: [H1]Qu'est ce que Fall From Heaven?[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Basé sur une longue campagne de Donjons et Dragons, Fall from Heaven Dans le monde de Dark-Fantasy d'Erebus. C'est un monde dans lequel les thèmes de corruption et de rédemption sont omniprésents et où tous , même les dieux, sont imparfaits.[PARAGRAPH:2]Bien que le mod ne soit pas directement une adaptation des mythes suivants, l'inspiration vient de la mythologie nordique et celtique , du mysticisme judéo-chrétien et de l'œuvre d'Edgar Allen Poe et de H.P. Lovecraft.[PARAGRAPH:2]Note de Kael: Le but de ce mod est de fournir un jeu de stratégie tour par tour basée sur le plasir de rejouer. Je suis un grand fan des Civilization mais au bout d'une douzaine de parties, elles commencent à toutes se ressembler. C'est déjà très surprenant, quel autre jeu pouvez-vous finir une douzaine de fois avant de seulement commencer à avoir l'impression que tout commence à se ressembler[PARAGRAPH:2]Nous avons poursuivi dans cette voie en prenant quelques décisions clés :[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]1.[TAB]Chaque civilisation est fondamentalement différente des autres. Bien plus qu'une unité et un batiment unique, nous voulons que le joueur ait à s'adapter à différentes stratégies et styles de jeu pour jouer chaque civ. Nous comprenons que tous les joueurs n'aimeraient pas toutes les civs, mais que chacun trouve celle qui corresponde à leur style ou que les joueurs en quète de nouvelles expériences en essayent une différente de ce dont ils ont l'habitude.[NEWLINE]2.[TAB]La religion d'état d'un joueur a un effet drastique sur sa civilisation.En fait il y a 7 manière de jouer une civilisation, une pour chaque religion.[NEWLINE]3.[TAB]Un refus général des options semblables. Biens qu' faciles à designer et à équilibrer , celles-ci sont généralement peu créatives. En fait nous créeons une option particulière et originale et tentons d'équilibrer l'ensemble plutôt que l'option nouvellement créer.[PARAGRAPH:2]Dans l'ensemble , cela implique que Fall From Heaven nécessite plus de temps pour être complètement pris en main par le joueur, mais nous pensons qu'une fois cela fait , il s'agit d'un jeu assez profond pour que les jouerus y passent des mois ou des années.
TEXT.German: [H1]Was ist Fall from Heaven?[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Basierend auf einer langen Kampagne von Dungeons and Dragons, Fall from Heaven spielt in der dunklen Fantasywelt Erebus. Es ist eine Welt, in der Korruption und Erlösung sich abwechseln und alle Charaktere, inklusive der Guten, unvollkommen sind.[PARAGRAPH:2]Obwohl diese Mod keine direkte Umsetzung der folgenden Einflüsse darstellt, stellen sie doch eine wichtige Inspirationsquelle dar. Zur Inspiration dienen die keltische und nordische Mythologie, der jüdisch-christliche Mystizismus sowie die Arbeiten von Edgar Allen Poe und Howard Phillips Lovecraft.[PARAGRAPH:2]Kael's Notiz: Das Ziel dieser Mod ist ein rundenbasiertes Spiel mit einer hohen Langzeitmotivation.Ich bin ein grosser Fan der Civilization Reihe, doch nach vielen Spielen fällt auf, daß das Spielgeschehen sich sehr ähnelt. Tatsächlich ist dies sehr bemerkenswert. Welches andere Spiel kann man so häufig spielen, bevor es langweilig wird?[PARAGRAPH:2]Das Ziel der Langzeitmotivation haben wir mit folgenden Entscheidungen verfolgt:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]1.[TAB]Jede Zivilisation sollte sich komplett von jeder anderen unterscheiden. Statt der Unterscheidung durch einzigartige Einheiten und Gebäude wollen wir den Spieler dazu bringen für jede Zivilisation eigene Strategien und Spielstile zu entwickeln. Wir wissen, daß nicht alle Spieler jede Zivilisation mögen werden, jedoch sollte jeder eine seinem Spielstil entsprechende Zivilisation finden. Spieler die eine neue Erfahrung suchen spielen dann einfach eine Zivilisation, die einen anderen neuen Spielstil erfordern.[NEWLINE]2.[TAB]Die Staatsreligion hat einen gewaltigen Effekt auf die Zivilisation. Daher gibt es eigentlich sieben Versionen jeder Zivilisation (Zivilisation + 7 verschiedene Religionen).[NEWLINE]3.[TAB]Eine generelle Abneigung gegen vorgefertigte Spielschemata. Obwohl einfach zu entwickeln und zu balancieren, sind vorgefertigte Spielschemata im allgemeinen unkreativ. Stattdessen haben wir jede einzelne Option individuell erstellt und auf das gesamte Spiel bezogen balanciert, anstatt die Option an sich zu balancieren. [PARAGRAPH:2]Daher besitzt Fall from Heaven einen höheren Lernanspruch, als die meisten anderen Spiele. Dies ist der Preis der entwickelten Optionen. Aber einmal erlernt hoffen wir, dass diese Mod komplex genug ist, um dem Spieler für Monate wenn nicht Jahre Spielspaß zu vermitteln.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]What is Fall from Heaven?[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Based on a long running Dungeons and Dragons campaign Fall from Heaven is set in the dark fantasy world of Erebus. This is a world where the themes of corruption and redemption are repeated and all the characters, including the gods themselves, are imperfect.[PARAGRAPH:2]Although the mod isn't a direct translation of any of the following inspiration comes from Celtic and Norse mythology, Judeo-Christian mysticism and the works of Edgar Allen Poe and H.P. Lovecraft.[PARAGRAPH:2]Kael's Notes: The goal of this mod is to provide a turn based strategy game with a focus on replayability. I am a huge fan of the Civilization series but after playing a dozen or so games they began to feel the same. That's actually a pretty amazing feat, what other game can you beat a dozen times before it starts to feel the same?[PARAGRAPH:2]We pursued our replayability goal by making a few key decisions:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]1.[TAB]Each civilization should be fundamentally different than any other. Much more than just a different Unique Unit and Unique Building we want the player to have to adapt to different strategies and play styles to play each civ. We understood that not all players would like all civs, but each would find some that appealed to their play style and players in for a new experience could try something that played differently than they were used to.[NEWLINE]2.[TAB]A players state religion should have a dramatic effect on his civilization. As such there are really 7 versions of each civilization, that civilization with each religion.[NEWLINE]3.[TAB]A general dislike for patterns. Although easy to design and balance patterns are generally uncreative. Instead we craft each option individually and try to balance overall rather than on the specific option being created.[PARAGRAPH:2]Overall this means that FfH has a higher learning curve than most games, all of these options come at a cost. But once learned our hope is that there is game deep enough for players to enjoy for months or years.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]¿Qué es Fall from Heaven?[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Basado en un largo recorrido de una campaña Dungeons and Dragons, Fall from Heaven se situa en el oscuro mundo de fantasía de Erebus. Es un mundo en el que los temas de la corrupción y la redención se repiten y todos los personajes, incluyendo los mismos dioses, son seres imperfectos.[PARAGRAPH:2]Aunque el mod no es una traducción directa de ninguna de las siguientes inspiraciones, proviene de la mitología Celta y Nórdica, del misticismo Judeo-Cristiano y de los trabajos de Edgar Allen Poe y H.P. Lovecraft.[PARAGRAPH:2]Notas de Kael: El objetivo de este mod es aportar un juego de estrategia por turnos con foco en la rejugabilidad. Soy un gran fan de la serie Civilization, pero después de jugar una docena o más partidas, empiezan a parecer lo mismo. Y esto es lo sorprendente, ¿qué otro juego puedes jugar docenas de veces antes de que empiece a parecer lo mismo?[PARAGRAPH:2]Hemos perseguido nuestro objetivo de rejugabilidad tomando algunas decisiones clave:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]1.[TAB]Cada civilización debería ser fundamentalmente diferente a las otras. Mucho más que una simple diferencia (como una unidad única o un edificio único) queremos que el jugador tenga que adoptar diferentes estrategias y diferentes estilos con cada civilización. Entendimos que no a todos los jugadores les gustaría todas las civilizaciones, pero cada uno encontraría algo que apelaron a su estilo de juego y jugadores por una nueva experiencia que podrían intentar algo que jugaron de manera diferente a lo que solían.[NEWLINE]2.[TAB]La religión oficial de un jugador tendría un dramático efecto en su civilización. Como que realmente hay 7 versiones de cada civilización, una por cada religión.[NEWLINE]3.[TAB]Un descontento general por pautas. Aunque fácil de diseñar y balancear, las pautas son generalmente poco creativas. En lugar de eso creamos cada opción individualmente e intentar equilibrarlo todo en lugar de en la opción específica siendo creada.[PARAGRAPH:2]Después de todo parece que FfH tiene una curva de aprendizaje más alta que la mayoría de los juegos, todas estas opciones vienen con un coste. Pero una vez aprendidas nuestra esperanza es que hay profundidad suficiente de juego para los jugadores para que lo disfruten durante meses o años.

TEXT.English: [H1]World Spells[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Each civilization was a World Spell they can use. These spells have a huge effect but can only be used once per game so consider carefully before you use them. The following are the world spells for each civilization:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Amurites- [LINK=SPELL_ARCANE_LACUNA]Arcane Lacuna[\LINK][NEWLINE]Balseraphs- [LINK=SPELL_REVELRY]Revelry[\LINK][NEWLINE]Bannor- [LINK=SPELL_RALLY]Rally[\LINK][NEWLINE]Calabim- [LINK=SPELL_RIVER_OF_BLOOD]River of Blood[\LINK][NEWLINE]Clan of Embers- [LINK=SPELL_FOR_THE_HORDE]For the Horde[\LINK][NEWLINE]Doviello- [LINK=SPELL_WILD_HUNT]Wild Hunt[\LINK][NEWLINE]Elohim- [LINK=SPELL_SANCTUARY]Sanctuary[\LINK][NEWLINE]Grigori- [LINK=SPELL_ARDOR]Ardor[\LINK][NEWLINE]Hippus- [LINK=SPELL_HIPPUS]Hippus[\LINK][NEWLINE]Illians- [LINK=SPELL_STASIS]Stasis[\LINK][NEWLINE]Infernal- [LINK=SPELL_HYBOREMS_WHISPER]Hyborem's Whisper[\LINK][NEWLINE]Khazad- [LINK=SPELL_MOTHER_LODE]Mother Lode[\LINK][NEWLINE]Kuriotates- [LINK=SPELL_LEGENDS]Legends[\LINK][NEWLINE]Lanun- [LINK=SPELL_RAGING_SEAS]Raging Seas[\LINK][NEWLINE]Ljosalfar- [LINK=SPELL_MARCH_OF_THE_TREES]March of the Trees[\LINK][NEWLINE]Luchuirp- [LINK=SPELL_GIFTS_OF_NANTOSUELTA]Gifts of Nantosuelta[\LINK][NEWLINE]Malakim- [LINK=SPELL_RELIGIOUS_FERVOR]Religious Fervor[\LINK][NEWLINE]Mercurians- [LINK=SPELL_DIVINE_RETRIBUTION]Divine Retribution[\LINK][NEWLINE]Sheaim- [LINK=SPELL_WORLDBREAK]Worldbreak[\LINK][NEWLINE]Sidar- [LINK=SPELL_INTO_THE_MIST]Into the Mist[\LINK][NEWLINE]Svartalfar- [LINK=SPELL_VEIL_OF_NIGHT]Veil of Night[\LINK][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Kael's Notes: We added these for two reasons. Of course they help us differentiate each of the civilizations. But we also wanted to add a strategic option where the player was forced to decide when was the best moment to use the ability. As such all of the World Spells generally grow more powerful over time, rewarding players who don't profit from there use early on.

TEXT.Italian: Alignment
TEXT.Spanish: Alineamiento

TEXT.English: [H1]Alignment[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Rise from Erebus features a DnD-style alignment system, with 9 possible alignments on two seperate axes. These axes are Good, Neutral, and Evil, and Lawful, Neutral, and Chaotic. Each leader starts with one from each axis, and some units and civics can only be used by players of a specific alignment. They also affect your diplomatic relations with other players, granting you bonuses to players of the same alignment (on that axis) and negatives to players of other alignments. [PARAGRAPH:2]Without the Broader Alignments game option selected, the only way to change your alignment is by adopting a State Religion. With the Broader Alignments option, many additional things can affect alignment; Units, Spells, Promotions, Events, Civics, Buildings. Some of these can only do so in lump-sum amounts, while others are able to do so via prolonged effects. [PARAGRAPH:2]Available Alignment combinations: Lawful Good, Neutral Good, Chaotic Good, Lawful Neutral, True Neutral, Chaotic Neutral, Lawful Evil, Neutral Evil, and Chaotic Evil.
TEXT.French: [H1]Alignement[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Rise from Erebus implémente un système d'alignement basé sur Donjons et Dragons, contenant 9 alignements possibles sur deux axes distincts.[NEWLINE]Ces axes sont:[NEWLINE][TAB]Bon, Neutre et Mauvais[NEWLINE][TAB]Loyal, Neutre et Chaotique.[NEWLINE]Chaque dirigeant commence en étant positionné sur ces deux axes (ex. Loyal Bon).[PARAGRAPH:2]Certaines unités et doctrines ne peuvent être utilisées que par les joueurs d'un alignement spécifique.[NEWLINE]Elles affectent également les relations diplomatiques avec les autres joueurs, vous conférant des bonus diplomatiques avec les joueurs de même alignement (sur un axe donné) et des malus avec les joueurs d'alignement différent.[PARAGRAPH:2]Sans avoir activé l'option des alignements enrichis, la seule façon de changer d'alignement est d'adopter une Religion d'État.Avec l'option activée, de nombreuses choses peuvent affecter votre alignement: unités, sorts, promotions, évènements, doctrines, constructions. Certaines influent de manière fixe, tandis que d'autres ont une influence à long terme.[PARAGRAPH:2]Les combinaisons possibles d'alignements sont : Loyal Bon, Neutre Bon, Chaotique Bon, Loyal Neutre, Neutre Neutre (Vrai Neutre), Chaotic Neutre, Loyal Mauvais, Neutre Mauvais et Chaotique Mauvais.
TEXT.German: [H1]Gesinnung[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Rise from Erebus enthält ein DnD (Dungeons'n'Dragons) Gesinnungssystem, das sich aus 9 unterschiedlichen Gesinnungen, die durch zwei Axen bestimmt werden. Die eine Achse enthält Gut, Neutral und Böse, die andere enthält Rechtschaffen, Neutral und Chaotisch. Jeder Anführer beginnt mit je einer Eigenschaft von jeder Achse, manche Einheiten und Staatsformen im Spiel können nur von Spielern mit einer bestimmten Gesinnung gewählt werden. Die Gesinnungen haben außerdem Einfluss auf die diplomatischen Beziehungen mit anderen Völkern, indem sie Boni für Spieler derselben Gesinnung und Mali bei Spielern einer anderen Gesinnung liefern. [PARAGRAPH:2]Ohne die Aktivierung der Breiteren Gesinnung im Spiel ist die einzige Möglichkeit, die eigene Gesinnung zu ändern, die Annahme von Staatsreligionen. Durch die Option Bereitere Gesinnung können viele weitere Dinge die Gesinnung beeinflussen. Einheiten, Zauber, Beförderungen, Ereignisse, Staatsformen, Gebäude. Manche von diesen verändern nur in geringem Maße etwas, während wieder andere über einen langen Zeitraum Wirkung entfalten.[PARAGRAPH:2]Verfügbare Kombinationen der Gesinnungen sind: [NEWLINE]Rechtschaffen Gut[NEWLINE]Neutral Gut[NEWLINE]Chaotisch Gut[NEWLINE]Rechtschaffen Neutral[NEWLINE]Neutral Neutral[NEWLINE]Chaotisch Neutral[NEWLINE]Rechtschaffen Böse[NEWLINE]Neutral Böse[NEWLINE]Chaotisch Böse.

[PARAGRAPH:2]Available Alignment combinations: Lawful Good, Neutral Good, Chaotic Good, Lawful Neutral, True Neutral, Chaotic Neutral, Lawful Evil, Neutral Evil, and Chaotic Evil.

TEXT.English: Altitude is a hidden property of tiles. It can have 4 values: water, flatland, hills or peak. Peaks are impassable for standard units (except mountaineer or flying). Movement cost for hills is 2.[NEWLINE]add more useful information here
TEXT.French: L'altitude est un propriété cachée des cases, qui peut prendre 4 valeurs : Eau, plaine, colline ou montagne. Les Montagnes sont infranchissables pour les unités standard (sauf les Montagnards ou les unités volantes), de même pour les cases d'eau (sauf pour les unités maritimes et volantes). Le coût en mouvement des collines est de 2.

TEXT.French: Mercenaires
TEXT.Italian: Mercenaries
TEXT.Spanish: Mercenaries

TEXT.English: A new system for Mercenaries is introduced in Ashes of Erebus. Once one of the civilizations researches Trade, Everyone will get access to a new Mercenary menu. In this menu, you'll be able to hire Mercenaries from a pool of units generated based on the world's technology, including units from Civilizations not currently in game. While expensive, both at hiring and when under contract, those units can be useful to strengthen an occasional weakness.[NEWLINE] Note that Mercenaries don't die when they lose a fight, but flee and leave your service. They will appear back in the Mercenary Pool, with their price evolving to indicate their increasing experience.[NEWLINE] Finally, some Leaders (most notably the Hippus) are able to send their own units to the Mercenary Pool (and call them back if needed). If one such unit is hired, the original owner will receive the fees.

TEXT.French: Doviello+
TEXT.Italian: Doviello+
TEXT.Spanish: Doviello+

TEXT.English: [H1]New Gameplay Mechanics:[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Animal Spawning:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Doviello cities will now periodically spawn animals, at a base chance of 4% per city each turn, reduced by .4% per population point in the city. This means that a standard city will no longer spawn animals once it hits 11 population. [NEWLINE]The spawn chance can be increased in two ways: It is doubled by the Doviello-only Membership civic, [LINK=CIVIC_WILDCOUNCIL]Council of the Wilds[\LINK], and increased by 50% when following Fellowship of the Leaves. [NEWLINE]Various National Wonders are required to allow each type of animal to spawn. Construction of these wonders also allow units built in the city a Kindred Spirit promotion. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=UNIT_WOLF]Wolves[\LINK] - Available from start. Becomes [LINK=UNIT_WOLF_PACK]Wolf Pack[\LINK] with [LINK=TECH_WARFARE]Warfare[\LINK].[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=UNIT_LION]Lions[\LINK] - [LINK=BUILDING_LION_DEN]Lion Den[\LINK], available with [LINK=TECH_MINING]Mining[\LINK]. Becomes [LINK=UNIT_SABRETOOTH]Sabretooth[\LINK] with [LINK=TECH_IRON_WORKING]Iron Working[\LINK]. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=UNIT_BEAR]Bears[\LINK] - [LINK=BUILDING_BEAR_DEN]Bear Den[\LINK], available with [LINK=TECH_SMELTING]Smelting[\LINK]. Becomes [LINK=UNIT_CAVE_BEARS]Cave Bears[\LINK] with [LINK=TECH_DIVINE_ESSENCE]Divine Essence[\LINK]. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=UNIT_MAMMOTH]Mammoths[\LINK] - [LINK=BUILDING_MAMMOTH_DEN]Mammoth Den[\LINK], available with [LINK=TECH_HORSEBACK_RIDING]Horseback Riding[\LINK]. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=UNIT_GRIFFON]Griffons[\LINK] - [LINK=BUILDING_GRIFFIN_WEYR]Griffon Weyr[\LINK], available with [LINK=TECH_ANIMAL_HANDLING]Animal Handling[\LINK]. Becomes [LINK=UNIT_HIPPOGRIFF]Hippogriff[\LINK] with [LINK=TECH_STIRRUPS]Stirrups[\LINK]. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=UNIT_STAG]Stags[\LINK] - [LINK=BUILDING_STAG_COPSE]Stag Copse[\LINK], available with [LINK=TECH_KNOWLEDGE_OF_THE_ETHER]Knowledge of the Ether[\LINK]. Becomes [LINK=UNIT_ELK]Elk[\LINK] with [LINK=TECH_PRIESTHOOD]Priesthood[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Kindred Spirits:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Doviello units built(or spawned) in a city containing an Animal Den will receive a Kindred Spirits promotion based on the type of den. These promotions are not initially very powerful, but all unlock a more powerful promotion later on. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=PROMOTION_MARK_WOLF]Mark of the Wolf[\LINK] - Grants 2 first strikes. Allows [LINK=PROMOTION_KINDRED_WOLF]Wolf Kindred[\LINK] with [LINK=PROMOTION_DRILL3]Drill 3[\LINK], granting 1 movement. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=PROMOTION_MARK_LION]Mark of the Lion[\LINK] - Courage. Allows [LINK=SPELL_MEZMERIZE_ANIMAL_KINDRED]Kindred Spirits[\LINK] at level 5. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=PROMOTION_MARK_BEAR]Mark of the Bear[\LINK] - March. Allows [LINK=PROMOTION_KINDRED_BEAR]Bear Kindred[\LINK] with [LINK=PROMOTION_COMBAT4]Combat 4[\LINK], granting 1 strength/defense. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=PROMOTION_MARK_GRIFFIN]Mark of the Griffon[\LINK] - Grants 2 sight. Allows [LINK=PROMOTION_KINDRED_GRIFFIN]Griffon Kindred[\LINK] with [LINK=PROMOTION_COMBAT2]Combat 2[\LINK] and [LINK=PROMOTION_DRILL2]Drill 2[\LINK], granting movement over impassable terrain. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=PROMOTION_MARK_STAG]Mark of the Stag[\LINK] - Grants Magic Resistance/Double Forest movement. Allows [LINK=PROMOTION_KINDRED_STAG]Stag Kindred[\LINK] with [LINK=PROMOTION_COMBAT5]Combat 5[\LINK], granting Magic Immunity. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=PROMOTION_MARK_MAMMOTH]Mark of the Mammoth[\LINK] - Grants 20% more experience from combat. Allows [LINK=SPELL_RIDE_MAMMOTH]Ride Mammoth[\LINK] at level 4, allowing the unit to mount a Mammoth.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Experience Sharing:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]New Doviello units inherit XP from your existing army, with diminishing returns so as to discourage swarming. Initially designed by MrUnderhill, this mechanic is complemented nicely by the Dueling System.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Duels:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Doviello units are now capable of challenging each other to duels. Any combat unit in a stack is able to use the [LINK=SPELL_DOVIELLO_CHALLENGE]Issue Challenge[\LINK] ability, allowing other units in the stack to use the [LINK=SPELL_DOVIELLO_CHALLENGE_ACCEPT]Accept Challenge[\LINK]. Each duel has a 10% chance for a tie, in which case each unit receives 10% of the other unit's XP, and a 4% chance for both units to die. The rest of the time, the duel will take actual combat odds into account, but just as in combat even a unit with 99.5% combat odds can lose. The victor receives 50% of the loser's XP, as well as a 2xp bonus, while the loser is destroyed. This is a very good way to trim an army after a war.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Looting:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]The Doviello will now loot weapons from the bodies of their enemies. If a defeated unit possessed Copper/Iron/Mithril weapons or an Enchanted Blade, the promotion will be gained by the victorious Doviello unit. This applies to Recon/Mounted/Arcane/Disciple units as well as Melee.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Scavengers:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]For five turns after a successful combat, Doviello units will not cost any maintenance, will heal an extra 5% in all territories, and can be sacrificed for 10 food in a city.[PARAGRAPH:2][H1]Changes to Leaders:[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=LEADER_CHARADON]Charadon:[\LINK][\BOLD] Charadon is now Aggressive/Warlord. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The Warlord trait, taken from [BOLD]Fall Flat[\BOLD], doubles the production speed of all training buildings and grants [LINK=PROMOTION_AMBITION]Ambition[\LINK] to all Melee, Recon, and Archery units.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=LEADER_MAHALA]Mahala:[\LINK][\BOLD] Mahala is now Neutral Financial/Ingenuity/Raiders, and received new art courtesy of Opera.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=LEADER_DUIN]Baron Duin Halfmorn:[\LINK][\BOLD] Baron Duin is a new leader for the Doviello. [NEWLINE]While the Baron is leading the Doviello, he is not available as a hero. In compensation, the Baron receives a unique hero, [LINK=UNIT_DOVIELLO_WEREWOLF]Varulv:[\LINK], at [LINK=TECH_FERAL_BOND]Feral Bond[\LINK]. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Evil Agnostic Lycanthropic. Favourite civic is slavery, wonder is Form of the Titan, the same as all other Doviello Leaders. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Lycanthopic grants 1 movement to all units, and allows [LINK=PROMOTION_CANNIBALIZE]Cannibalize[\LINK] with [LINK=PROMOTION_COMBAT2]Combat 2[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][H1]New/Changed Units:[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_STAG]Stag:[\LINK][\BOLD] 3 strength, is able to cast Haste and Treetop Defense. Available to the Animal civilization, the Stag will spawn in forests.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_ELK]Elk:[\LINK][\BOLD] 5 strength, is able to cast Haste, Regenerate, Poisoned Blade, Fertility, and Treetop Defense. Has Divine/Channeling2, and is guaranteed to begin with your state religion. Doviello-only Beast unit.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_MAMMOTH]Mammoth:[\LINK][\BOLD] Elephant clone, can be upgraded to [LINK=UNIT_MAMMOTH_RIDER]Mammoth Rider[\LINK]. Begins with Winterborn, is available to the Animal civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_MAMMOTH_RIDER]Mammoth Rider:[\LINK][\BOLD] 1 strength more than War Elephants, available to all civilizations. Amurite model from AoI is the standard, while the Doviello and Illians receive unique versions. Starts with Winterborn.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_BEAR_PACK]Bear Pack:[\LINK][\BOLD] 7 strength, is formed like a Wolf Pack. Max strength of 18. Can create a Bear Den, reverting to the Animal Civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_CAVE_BEARS]Cave Bears:[\LINK][\BOLD] 9 strength. Massive beast.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_CAVE_BEARS_PACK]Cave Bear Pack:[\LINK][\BOLD] 12 strength, is formed like a Wolf Pack. Max strength of 27. Can create a Cave Bear Den, reverting to the Animal Civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_LION_PACK]Lion Pride:[\LINK][\BOLD] 6 strength, is formed like a Wolf Pack. Max strength of 12. Can create a Lion Den, reverting to the Animal Civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_SABRETOOTH]Sabretooth:[\LINK][\BOLD] 6 strength. Available to the Animal civilization, the Sabretooth can spawn on Taiga and Tundra. Model by Warkirby.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_SABRETOOTH_HERO]Sabretooth Pride:[\LINK][\BOLD] 8 strength, is formed like a Wolf Pack. Max strength of 16. Can create a Sabretooth Den, reverting to the Animal Civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_GRIFFON]Griffon:[\LINK][\BOLD] New model by Warkirby.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_GRIFFON_PACK]Griffon Flight:[\LINK][\BOLD] 6 strength, is formed like a Wolf Pack. Max strength of 15. Can create a Griffon Weyr, reverting to the Animal Civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_HIPPOGRIFF]Hippogriff:[\LINK][\BOLD] 4 strength, same strength as the Griffon but is able to carry cargo. Available to the Animal civilization, and can spawn everywhere a normal Griffon does. Model by Warkirby.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_HIPPOGRIFF_FLIGHT]Hippogriff Flight:[\LINK][\BOLD] 6 strength, is formed like a Wolf Pack. Max strength of 15. Can create a Hippogriff Weyr, reverting to the Animal Civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_BEAR_RIDER]Bear Rider:[\LINK][\BOLD] Horse Archer UU. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]8 strength rather than 6, no ranged attack, no defensive strikes. Does not require Archery.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_LUCIAN]Lucian:[\LINK][\BOLD] Lucian gains 'Battle-Hardened'. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]0.5 experience per turn, to a max of 50. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]10% chance to avoid bad lair results. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]10% chance to resist spells. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Allows Heroic Strength/Defense 1.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_DOVIELLO_WEREWOLF]Varulv:[\LINK][\BOLD] New Werewolf hero, available only to Duin. Requires [LINK=TECH_FERAL_BOND]Feral Bond[\LINK], same stats as the Baron. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Can use the [LINK=SPELL_VARULV_SPELL]Feral Howl[\LINK] ability every 15 turns, enraging all recon units on the tile for 10 turnsand allowing them to become Blooded Werewolves if successful in combat.[PARAGRAPH:2][H1]Spells and Civics:[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=SPELL_WILD_HUNT]Call of the Wild:[\LINK][\BOLD] New Worldspell. Grants the caster a new animal for every animal he already controls, with a 20% chance for any promotion possessed by the parent to be passed on to the child.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Create Den:[\BOLD] Wolf Packs, Lion Prides, Griffon Flights, and Bear Packs can now cast this spell, creating an animal lair and reverting to the Animal Civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=CIVIC_WILDCOUNCIL]Council of the Wilds:[\LINK][\BOLD] Doviello-only Membership civic. Doubles animal spawn rate, at the cost of not running Under/Overcouncil.[PARAGRAPH:2][H1]Buildings and Resources:[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=BUILDING_LION_DEN]Lion Den:[\LINK][\BOLD] Available with [LINK=TECH_MINING]Mining[\LINK]. [NEWLINE]Grants a Kindred Spirits promotion to all units built in the city, and allows Lions to spawn.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=BUILDING_BEAR_DEN]Bear Den:[\LINK][\BOLD] Available with [LINK=TECH_SMELTING]Smelting[\LINK]. [NEWLINE]Grants a Kindred Spirits promotion to all units built in the city, and allows Bears to spawn.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=BUILDING_MAMMOTH_DEN]Mammoth Den:[\LINK][\BOLD] Available with [LINK=TECH_HORSEBACK_RIDING]Horseback Riding[\LINK]. [NEWLINE]Grants a Kindred Spirits promotion to all units built in the city, and allows Mammoths to spawn.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=BUILDING_GRIFFIN_WEYR]Griffon Weyr:[\LINK][\BOLD] Available with [LINK=TECH_ANIMAL_HANDLING]Animal Handling[\LINK]. [NEWLINE]Grants a Kindred Spirits promotion to all units built in the city, and allows Griffons to spawn.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=BUILDING_STAG_COPSE]Stag Copse:[\LINK][\BOLD] Available with [LINK=TECH_KNOWLEDGE_OF_THE_ETHER]Knowledge of the Ether[\LINK] [NEWLINE]Grants a Kindred Spirits promotion to all units built in the city, and allows Stags to spawn.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=RESOURCE_BISON]Bison:[\LINK][\BOLD] Northern cows. Doviello gain a small flavourstart bonus for them.
TEXT.French: [H1]Nouvelles Mécaniques de Jeu:[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Apparition d'Animaux:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Les villes Doviello font maintenant apparaître périodiquement des Animaux. La probabilité d'apparition à chaque tour est de 4% par ville, reduit de 0,4% par point de population dans la ville. Cela signifie donc qu'une ville de 11 de population ne fera plus apparaître d'Animaux.[NEWLINE]La probabilité d'apparition peut être augmentée de deux manières : elle est doublée par la Doctrine spécifique aux Doviellos, le [LINK=CIVIC_WILDCOUNCIL]Conseil de la Nature Sauvage[\LINK], et augmentée de 50% par la religion Communauté des Feuilles.[NEWLINE]Diverses Merveilles Nationales sont nécessaires pour permettre aux différents types d'Animaux d'apparaître. La construction de ces Merveilles permet également aux unités construites dans la ville d'obtenir la promotion Âme Jumelle.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=UNIT_WOLF]Loups[\LINK] : disponibles dès le début.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=UNIT_LION]Lions[\LINK] : nécessite la [LINK=BUILDING_LION_DEN]Tanière des Lions[\LINK], disponible après avoir découvert le [LINK=TECH_MINING]Minage[\LINK]. Évolue en [LINK=UNIT_SABRETOOTH]Dent-de-Sabre[\LINK] après avoir découvert le [LINK=TECH_IRON_WORKING]Travail du Fer[\LINK].[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=UNIT_BEAR]Ours[\LINK] : nécessite l'[LINK=BUILDING_BEAR_DEN]Antre des Ours[\LINK], disponible après avoir découvert la [LINK=TECH_SMELTING]Forge[\LINK]. Évolue en [LINK=UNIT_CAVE_BEARS]Ours des Cavernes[\LINK] après avoir découvert l'[LINK=TECH_DIVINE_ESSENCE]Essence Divine[\LINK].[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=UNIT_MAMMOTH]Mammouths[\LINK] : nécessite l'[LINK=BUILDING_MAMMOTH_DEN]Antre des Mammouths[\LINK], disponible après avoir découvert l'[LINK=TECH_HORSEBACK_RIDING]Équitation[\LINK].[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=UNIT_GRIFFON]Griffons[\LINK] : nécessite l' [LINK=BUILDING_GRIFFIN_WEYR]Aire des Griffons[\LINK], disponible après avoir découvert le [LINK=TECH_ANIMAL_HANDLING]Dressage[\LINK]. Évolue en [LINK=UNIT_HIPPOGRIFF]Hippogriffe[\LINK] après avoir découvert les [LINK=TECH_STIRRUPS]Étriers[\LINK].[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=UNIT_STAG]Cerfs[\LINK] : nécessite le [LINK=BUILDING_STAG_COPSE]Taillis des Cerfs[\LINK], disponible après avoir découvert la [LINK=TECH_KNOWLEDGE_OF_THE_ETHER]Connaissance de l'Ether[\LINK]. Évolue en [LINK=UNIT_ELK]Élan[\LINK] après la découverte du [LINK=TECH_PRIESTHOOD]Clergé[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Âmes Jumelles:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Les unités Doviellos construites (ou apparues) dans une ville contenant une Tanière d'Animaux recevront la promotion Âme Jumelles basée sur le type de Tanière. Ces promotions ne sont initialement pas très puissantes, mais elles permettent toutes d'en débloquer une plus puissante plus tard.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=PROMOTION_MARK_WOLF]Marque du Loup[\LINK] : Confère 2 premières attaques. Débloque l'accès à la promotion [LINK=PROMOTION_KINDRED_WOLF]Lupin[\LINK] avec [LINK=PROMOTION_DRILL3]Exercice 3[\LINK], conférant +1 mouvement.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=PROMOTION_MARK_LION]Marque du Lion[\LINK] = Courage. Débloque l'accès à la promotion [LINK=SPELL_MEZMERIZE_ANIMAL_KINDRED]Âme Jumelles[\LINK] au niveau 5.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=PROMOTION_MARK_BEAR]Marque de l'Ours[\LINK] = Marche. Débloque l'accès à la promotion LINK=PROMOTION_KINDRED_BEAR]Ursidé[\LINK] avec [LINK=PROMOTION_COMBAT4]Combat 4[\LINK], conférant 1 force/défense.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=PROMOTION_MARK_GRIFFIN]Marque du Griffon[\LINK] : Confère +2 en vision. Débloque l'accès à la promotion [LINK=PROMOTION_KINDRED_GRIFFIN]Apparenté aux Griffons[\LINK] avec [LINK=PROMOTION_COMBAT2]Combat 2[\LINK] et [LINK=PROMOTION_DRILL2]Exercice 2[\LINK], permettant de se déplacer sur les cases infranchissables.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=PROMOTION_MARK_STAG]Marque du Cerf[\LINK] : Fournit une résistance à la magie et double le mouvement en forêt. Débloque l'accès à la promotion [LINK=PROMOTION_KINDRED_STAG]Cervidé[\LINK] avec [LINK=PROMOTION_COMBAT5]Combat 5[\LINK], conférant l'Immunité à la Magie.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=PROMOTION_MARK_MAMMOTH]Marque du Mammouth[\LINK] : Augmente de 20% le gain d'expérience lors des combats. Débloque l'accès au sort [LINK=SPELL_RIDE_MAMMOTH]Chevaucher un Mammouth[\LINK] au niveau 4, permettant à l'unité de chevaucher un Mammouth.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Partage d'expérience :[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Les nouvelles unités Doviellos héritent d'un peu d'XP de votre armée existante, avec des rendements décroissants pour éviter la multiplication des unités. Ce mécanisme est complété par le système de Duel.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Duels:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Les unités Doviellos sont capables de se défier entre elles. N'importe quelle unité de la pile est capable d'utiliser la compétence [LINK=SPELL_DOVIELLO_CHALLENGE]Lancer un Défi[\LINK], permettant aux autres unités de la pile d'[LINK=SPELL_DOVIELLO_CHALLENGE_ACCEPT]Accepter le Duel[\LINK]. Chaque duel a 10% de chances de finir sur une égalité, auquel cas chaque unité reçoit 10% de l'XP de l'autre unité, et 4% de chances que les deux unités meurent. Autrement, le duel prendra en compte les probabilités du combat, mais comme dans n'importe quel combat une unité ayant 99,5% de chances de gagner peut toujours perdre. Le gagnant reçoit 50% de l'XP du perdant, ainsi que 2 XP bonus, tandis que le perdant est détruit. C'est un très bon moyen de réduire les effectifs après une guerre.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Pillage:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Les unités Doviellos récupèrent les armes sur les corps des ennemis vaincus. Si une unité ennemie possédait des armes en Cuivre/Fer/Mithril ou une Lame Enchantée, l'unité Doviello victorieuse gagnera automatiquement la promotion. TEXT.German: [H1]New Gameplay Mechanics:[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Animal Spawning:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Doviello cities will now periodically spawn animals, at a base chance of 4% per city each turn, reduced by .4% per population point in the city. This means that a standard city will no longer spawn animals once it hits 11 population. [NEWLINE]The spawn chance can be increased in two ways: It is doubled by the Doviello-only Membership civic, [LINK=CIVIC_WILDCOUNCIL]Council of the Wilds[\LINK], and increased by 50% when following Fellowship of the Leaves. [NEWLINE]Various National Wonders are required to allow each type of animal to spawn. Construction of these wonders also allow units built in the city a Kindred Spirit promotion. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=UNIT_WOLF]Wolves[\LINK] - Available from start. Becomes [LINK=UNIT_WOLF_PACK]Wolf Pack[\LINK] with [LINK=TECH_WARFARE]Warfare[\LINK].[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=UNIT_LION]Lions[\LINK] - [LINK=BUILDING_LION_DEN]Lion Den[\LINK], available with [LINK=TECH_MINING]Mining[\LINK]. Becomes [LINK=UNIT_SABRETOOTH]Sabretooth[\LINK] with [LINK=TECH_IRON_WORKING]Iron Working[\LINK]. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=UNIT_BEAR]Bears[\LINK] - [LINK=BUILDING_BEAR_DEN]Bear Den[\LINK], available with [LINK=TECH_SMELTING]Smelting[\LINK]. Becomes [LINK=UNIT_CAVE_BEARS]Cave Bear[\LINK] with [LINK=TECH_DIVINE_ESSENCE]Divine Essence[\LINK]. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=UNIT_MAMMOTH]Mammoths[\LINK] - [LINK=BUILDING_MAMMOTH_DEN]Mammoth Den[\LINK], available with [LINK=TECH_HORSEBACK_RIDING]Horseback Riding[\LINK]. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=UNIT_GRIFFON]Griffons[\LINK] - [LINK=BUILDING_GRIFFIN_WEYR]Griffon Weyr[\LINK], available with [LINK=TECH_ANIMAL_HANDLING]Animal Handling[\LINK]. Becomes [LINK=UNIT_HIPPOGRIFF]Hippogriff[\LINK] with [LINK=TECH_STIRRUPS]Stirrups[\LINK]. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=UNIT_STAG]Stags[\LINK] - [LINK=BUILDING_STAG_COPSE]Stag Copse[\LINK], available with [LINK=TECH_KNOWLEDGE_OF_THE_ETHER]Knowledge of the Ether[\LINK]. Becomes [LINK=UNIT_ELK]Elk[\LINK] with [LINK=TECH_PRIESTHOOD]Priesthood[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Kindred Spirits:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Doviello units built(or spawned) in a city containing an Animal Den will receive a Kindred Spirits promotion based on the type of den. These promotions are not initially very powerful, but all unlock a more powerful promotion later on. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=PROMOTION_MARK_WOLF]Mark of the Wolf[\LINK] - Grants 2 first strikes. Allows [LINK=PROMOTION_KINDRED_WOLF]Wolf Kindred[\LINK] with [LINK=PROMOTION_DRILL3]Drill 3[\LINK], granting 1 movement. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=PROMOTION_MARK_LION]Mark of the Lion[\LINK] - Courage. Allows [LINK=SPELL_MEZMERIZE_ANIMAL_KINDRED]Kindred Spirits[\LINK] at level 5. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=PROMOTION_MARK_BEAR]Mark of the Bear[\LINK] - March. Allows [LINK=PROMOTION_KINDRED_BEAR]Bear Kindred[\LINK] with [LINK=PROMOTION_COMBAT4]Combat 4[\LINK], granting 1 strength/defense. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=PROMOTION_MARK_GRIFFIN]Mark of the Griffon[\LINK] - Grants 2 sight. Allows [LINK=PROMOTION_KINDRED_GRIFFIN]Griffon Kindred[\LINK] with [LINK=PROMOTION_COMBAT2]Combat 2[\LINK] and [LINK=PROMOTION_DRILL2]Drill 2[\LINK], granting movement over impassable terrain. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=PROMOTION_MARK_STAG]Mark of the Stag[\LINK] - Grants Magic Resistance/Double Forest movement. Allows [LINK=PROMOTION_KINDRED_STAG]Stag Kindred[\LINK] with [LINK=PROMOTION_COMBAT5]Combat 5[\LINK], granting Magic Immunity. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=PROMOTION_MARK_MAMMOTH]Mark of the Mammoth[\LINK] - Grants 20% more experience from combat. Allows [LINK=SPELL_RIDE_MAMMOTH]Ride Mammoth[\LINK] at level 4, allowing the unit to mount a Mammoth.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Experience Sharing:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]New Doviello units inherit XP from your existing army, with diminishing returns so as to discourage swarming. Initially designed by MrUnderhill, this mechanic is complemented nicely by the Dueling System.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Duels:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Doviello units are now capable of challenging each other to duels. Any combat unit in a stack is able to use the [LINK=SPELL_DOVIELLO_CHALLENGE]Issue Challenge[\LINK] ability, allowing other units in the stack to use the [LINK=SPELL_DOVIELLO_CHALLENGE_ACCEPT]Accept Challenge[\LINK]. Each duel has a 10% chance for a tie, in which case each unit receives 10% of the other unit's XP, and a 4% chance for both units to die. The rest of the time, the duel will take actual combat odds into account, but just as in combat even a unit with 99.5% combat odds can lose. The victor receives 50% of the loser's XP, as well as a 2xp bonus, while the loser is destroyed. This is a very good way to trim an army after a war.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Looting:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]The Doviello will now loot weapons from the bodies of their enemies. If a defeated unit possessed Copper/Iron/Mithril weapons or an Enchanted Blade, the promotion will be gained by the victorious Doviello unit. This applies to Recon/Mounted/Arcane/Disciple units as well as Melee.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Scavengers:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]For five turns after a successful combat, Doviello units will not cost any maintenance, will heal an extra 5% in all territories, and can be sacrificed for 10 food in a city.[PARAGRAPH:2][H1]Changes to Leaders:[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=LEADER_CHARADON]Charadon:[\LINK][\BOLD] Charadon is now Aggressive/Warlord. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The Warlord trait, taken from [BOLD]Fall Flat[\BOLD], doubles the production speed of all training buildings and grants [LINK=PROMOTION_AMBITION]Ambition[\LINK] to all Melee, Recon, and Archery units.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=LEADER_MAHALA]Mahala:[\LINK][\BOLD] Mahala is now Neutral Financial/Ingenuity/Raiders, and received new art courtesy of Opera.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=LEADER_DUIN]Baron Duin Halfmorn:[\LINK][\BOLD] Baron Duin is a new leader for the Doviello. [NEWLINE]While the Baron is leading the Doviello, he is not available as a hero. In compensation, the Baron receives a unique hero, [LINK=UNIT_DOVIELLO_WEREWOLF]Varulv:[\LINK], at [LINK=TECH_FERAL_BOND]Feral Bond[\LINK]. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Evil Agnostic Lycanthropic. Favourite civic is slavery, wonder is Form of the Titan, the same as all other Doviello Leaders. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Lycanthopic grants 1 movement to all units, and allows [LINK=PROMOTION_CANNIBALIZE]Cannibalize[\LINK] with [LINK=PROMOTION_COMBAT2]Combat 2[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][H1]New/Changed Units:[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_STAG]Stag:[\LINK][\BOLD] 3 strength, is able to cast Haste and Treetop Defense. Available to the Animal civilization, the Stag will spawn in forests.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_ELK]Elk:[\LINK][\BOLD] 5 strength, is able to cast Haste, Regenerate, Poisoned Blade, Fertility, and Treetop Defense. Has Divine/Channeling2, and is guaranteed to begin with your state religion. Doviello-only Beast unit.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_MAMMOTH]Mammoth:[\LINK][\BOLD] Elephant clone, can be upgraded to [LINK=UNIT_MAMMOTH_RIDER]Mammoth Rider[\LINK]. Begins with Winterborn, is available to the Animal civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_MAMMOTH_RIDER]Mammoth Rider:[\LINK][\BOLD] 1 strength more than War Elephants, available to all civilizations. Amurite model from AoI is the standard, while the Doviello and Illians receive unique versions. Starts with Winterborn.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_BEAR_PACK]Bear Pack:[\LINK][\BOLD] 7 strength, is formed like a Wolf Pack. Max strength of 18. Can create a Bear Den, reverting to the Animal Civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_CAVE_BEARS]Cave Bear:[\LINK][\BOLD] 9 strength. Massive beast.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_CAVE_BEARS_PACK]Cave Bear Pack:[\LINK][\BOLD] 12 strength, is formed like a Wolf Pack. Max strength of 27. Can create a Cave Bear Den, reverting to the Animal Civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_LION_PACK]Lion Pride:[\LINK][\BOLD] 6 strength, is formed like a Wolf Pack. Max strength of 12. Can create a Lion Den, reverting to the Animal Civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_SABRETOOTH]Sabretooth:[\LINK][\BOLD] 6 strength. Available to the Animal civilization, the Sabretooth can spawn on Taiga and Tundra. Model by Warkirby.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_SABRETOOTH_HERO]Sabretooth Pride:[\LINK][\BOLD] 8 strength, is formed like a Wolf Pack. Max strength of 16. Can create a Sabretooth Den, reverting to the Animal Civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_GRIFFON]Griffon:[\LINK][\BOLD] New model by Warkirby.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_GRIFFON_PACK]Griffon Flight:[\LINK][\BOLD] 6 strength, is formed like a Wolf Pack. Max strength of 15. Can create a Griffon Weyr, reverting to the Animal Civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_HIPPOGRIFF]Hippogriff:[\LINK][\BOLD] 4 strength, same strength as the Griffon but is able to carry cargo. Available to the Animal civilization, and can spawn everywhere a normal Griffon does. Model by Warkirby.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_HIPPOGRIFF_FLIGHT]Hippogriff Flight:[\LINK][\BOLD] 6 strength, is formed like a Wolf Pack. Max strength of 15. Can create a Hippogriff Weyr, reverting to the Animal Civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_BEAR_RIDER]Bear Rider:[\LINK][\BOLD] Horse Archer UU. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]8 strength rather than 6, no ranged attack, no defensive strikes. Does not require Archery.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_LUCIAN]Lucian:[\LINK][\BOLD] Lucian gains 'Battle-Hardened'. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]0.5 experience per turn, to a max of 50. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]10% chance to avoid bad lair results. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]10% chance to resist spells. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Allows Heroic Strength/Defense 1.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_DOVIELLO_WEREWOLF]Varulv:[\LINK][\BOLD] New Werewolf hero, available only to Duin. Requires [LINK=TECH_FERAL_BOND]Feral Bond[\LINK], same stats as the Baron. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Can use the [LINK=SPELL_VARULV_SPELL]Feral Howl[\LINK] ability every 15 turns, enraging all recon units on the tile for 10 turnsand allowing them to become Blooded Werewolves if successful in combat.[PARAGRAPH:2][H1]Spells and Civics:[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=SPELL_WILD_HUNT]Call of the Wild:[\LINK][\BOLD] New Worldspell. Grants the caster a new animal for every animal he already controls, with a 20% chance for any promotion possessed by the parent to be passed on to the child.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Create Den:[\BOLD] Wolf Packs, Lion Prides, Griffon Flights, and Bear Packs can now cast this spell, creating an animal lair and reverting to the Animal Civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=CIVIC_WILDCOUNCIL]Council of the Wilds:[\LINK][\BOLD] Doviello-only Membership civic. Doubles animal spawn rate, at the cost of not running Under/Overcouncil.[PARAGRAPH:2][H1]Buildings and Resources:[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=BUILDING_LION_DEN]Lion Den:[\LINK][\BOLD] Available with [LINK=TECH_MINING]Mining[\LINK]. [NEWLINE]Grants a Kindred Spirits promotion to all units built in the city, and allows Lions to spawn.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=BUILDING_BEAR_DEN]Bear Den:[\LINK][\BOLD] Available with [LINK=TECH_SMELTING]Smelting[\LINK]. [NEWLINE]Grants a Kindred Spirits promotion to all units built in the city, and allows Bears to spawn.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=BUILDING_MAMMOTH_DEN]Mammoth Den:[\LINK][\BOLD] Available with [LINK=TECH_HORSEBACK_RIDING]Horseback Riding[\LINK]. [NEWLINE]Grants a Kindred Spirits promotion to all units built in the city, and allows Mammoths to spawn.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=BUILDING_GRIFFIN_WEYR]Griffon Weyr:[\LINK][\BOLD] Available with [LINK=TECH_ANIMAL_HANDLING]Animal Handling[\LINK]. [NEWLINE]Grants a Kindred Spirits promotion to all units built in the city, and allows Griffons to spawn.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=BUILDING_STAG_COPSE]Stag Copse:[\LINK][\BOLD] Available with [LINK=TECH_KNOWLEDGE_OF_THE_ETHER]Knowledge of the Ether[\LINK] [NEWLINE]Grants a Kindred Spirits promotion to all units built in the city, and allows Stags to spawn.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=RESOURCE_BISON]Bison:[\LINK][\BOLD] Northern cows. Doviello gain a small flavourstart bonus for them.

[NEWLINE]Various National Wonders are required to allow each type of animal to spawn. Construction of these wonders also allow units built in the city a Kindred Spirit promotion. Becomes [LINK=UNIT_WOLF_PACK]Wolf Pack[\LINK] with [LINK=TECH_WARFARE]Warfare[\LINK].[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=UNIT_LION]Lions[\LINK] - [LINK=BUILDING_LION_DEN]Lion Den[\LINK], available with [LINK=TECH_MINING]Mining[\LINK]. Becomes [LINK=UNIT_SABRETOOTH]Sabretooth[\LINK] with [LINK=TECH_IRON_WORKING]Iron Working[\LINK]. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=UNIT_BEAR]Bears[\LINK] - [LINK=BUILDING_BEAR_DEN]Bear Den[\LINK], available with [LINK=TECH_SMELTING]Smelting[\LINK]. Becomes [LINK=UNIT_CAVE_BEARS]Cave Bear[\LINK] with [LINK=TECH_DIVINE_ESSENCE]Divine Essence[\LINK]. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=UNIT_MAMMOTH]Mammoths[\LINK] - [LINK=BUILDING_MAMMOTH_DEN]Mammoth Den[\LINK], available with [LINK=TECH_HORSEBACK_RIDING]Horseback Riding[\LINK]. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=UNIT_GRIFFON]Griffons[\LINK] - [LINK=BUILDING_GRIFFIN_WEYR]Griffon Weyr[\LINK], available with [LINK=TECH_ANIMAL_HANDLING]Animal Handling[\LINK]. Becomes [LINK=UNIT_HIPPOGRIFF]Hippogriff[\LINK] with [LINK=TECH_STIRRUPS]Stirrups[\LINK]. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=UNIT_STAG]Stags[\LINK] - [LINK=BUILDING_STAG_COPSE]Stag Copse[\LINK], available with [LINK=TECH_KNOWLEDGE_OF_THE_ETHER]Knowledge of the Ether[\LINK]. Becomes [LINK=UNIT_ELK]Elk[\LINK] with [LINK=TECH_PRIESTHOOD]Priesthood[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Kindred Spirits:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Doviello units built(or spawned) in a city containing an Animal Den will receive a Kindred Spirits promotion based on the type of den. These promotions are not initially very powerful, but all unlock a more powerful promotion later on. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=PROMOTION_MARK_WOLF]Mark of the Wolf[\LINK] - Grants 2 first strikes. Allows [LINK=PROMOTION_KINDRED_WOLF]Wolf Kindred[\LINK] with [LINK=PROMOTION_DRILL3]Drill 3[\LINK], granting 1 movement. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=PROMOTION_MARK_LION]Mark of the Lion[\LINK] - Courage. Allows [LINK=SPELL_MEZMERIZE_ANIMAL_KINDRED]Kindred Spirits[\LINK] at level 5. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=PROMOTION_MARK_BEAR]Mark of the Bear[\LINK] - March. Allows [LINK=PROMOTION_KINDRED_BEAR]Bear Kindred[\LINK] with [LINK=PROMOTION_COMBAT4]Combat 4[\LINK], granting 1 strength/defense. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=PROMOTION_MARK_GRIFFIN]Mark of the Griffon[\LINK] - Grants 2 sight. Allows [LINK=PROMOTION_KINDRED_GRIFFIN]Griffon Kindred[\LINK] with [LINK=PROMOTION_COMBAT2]Combat 2[\LINK] and [LINK=PROMOTION_DRILL2]Drill 2[\LINK], granting movement over impassable terrain. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=PROMOTION_MARK_STAG]Mark of the Stag[\LINK] - Grants Magic Resistance/Double Forest movement. Allows [LINK=PROMOTION_KINDRED_STAG]Stag Kindred[\LINK] with [LINK=PROMOTION_COMBAT5]Combat 5[\LINK], granting Magic Immunity. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][LINK=PROMOTION_MARK_MAMMOTH]Mark of the Mammoth[\LINK] - Grants 20% more experience from combat. Allows [LINK=SPELL_RIDE_MAMMOTH]Ride Mammoth[\LINK] at level 4, allowing the unit to mount a Mammoth.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Experience Sharing:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]New Doviello units inherit XP from your existing army, with diminishing returns so as to discourage swarming. Initially designed by MrUnderhill, this mechanic is complemented nicely by the Dueling System.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Duels:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Doviello units are now capable of challenging each other to duels. Any combat unit in a stack is able to use the [LINK=SPELL_DOVIELLO_CHALLENGE]Issue Challenge[\LINK] ability, allowing other units in the stack to use the [LINK=SPELL_DOVIELLO_CHALLENGE_ACCEPT]Accept Challenge[\LINK]. Each duel has a 10% chance for a tie, in which case each unit receives 10% of the other unit's XP, and a 4% chance for both units to die. The rest of the time, the duel will take actual combat odds into account, but just as in combat even a unit with 99.5% combat odds can lose. The victor receives 50% of the loser's XP, as well as a 2xp bonus, while the loser is destroyed. This is a very good way to trim an army after a war.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Looting:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]The Doviello will now loot weapons from the bodies of their enemies. If a defeated unit possessed Copper/Iron/Mithril weapons or an Enchanted Blade, the promotion will be gained by the victorious Doviello unit. This applies to Recon/Mounted/Arcane/Disciple units as well as Melee.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Scavengers:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]For five turns after a successful combat, Doviello units will not cost any maintenance, will heal an extra 5% in all territories, and can be sacrificed for 10 food in a city.[PARAGRAPH:2][H1]Changes to Leaders:[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=LEADER_CHARADON]Charadon:[\LINK][\BOLD] Charadon is now Aggressive/Warlord. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The Warlord trait, taken from [BOLD]Fall Flat[\BOLD], doubles the production speed of all training buildings and grants [LINK=PROMOTION_AMBITION]Ambition[\LINK] to all Melee, Recon, and Archery units.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=LEADER_MAHALA]Mahala:[\LINK][\BOLD] Mahala is now Neutral Financial/Ingenuity/Raiders, and received new art courtesy of Opera.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=LEADER_DUIN]Baron Duin Halfmorn:[\LINK][\BOLD] Baron Duin is a new leader for the Doviello. [NEWLINE]While the Baron is leading the Doviello, he is not available as a hero. In compensation, the Baron receives a unique hero, [LINK=UNIT_DOVIELLO_WEREWOLF]Varulv:[\LINK], at [LINK=TECH_FERAL_BOND]Feral Bond[\LINK]. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Evil Agnostic Lycanthropic. Favourite civic is slavery, wonder is Form of the Titan, the same as all other Doviello Leaders. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Lycanthopic grants 1 movement to all units, and allows [LINK=PROMOTION_CANNIBALIZE]Cannibalize[\LINK] with [LINK=PROMOTION_COMBAT2]Combat 2[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][H1]New/Changed Units:[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_STAG]Stag:[\LINK][\BOLD] 3 strength, is able to cast Haste and Treetop Defense. Available to the Animal civilization, the Stag will spawn in forests.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_ELK]Elk:[\LINK][\BOLD] 5 strength, is able to cast Haste, Regenerate, Poisoned Blade, Fertility, and Treetop Defense. Has Divine/Channeling2, and is guaranteed to begin with your state religion. Doviello-only Beast unit.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_MAMMOTH]Mammoth:[\LINK][\BOLD] Elephant clone, can be upgraded to [LINK=UNIT_MAMMOTH_RIDER]Mammoth Rider[\LINK]. Begins with Winterborn, is available to the Animal civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_MAMMOTH_RIDER]Mammoth Rider:[\LINK][\BOLD] 1 strength more than War Elephants, available to all civilizations. Amurite model from AoI is the standard, while the Doviello and Illians receive unique versions. Starts with Winterborn.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_BEAR_PACK]Bear Pack:[\LINK][\BOLD] 7 strength, is formed like a Wolf Pack. Max strength of 18. Can create a Bear Den, reverting to the Animal Civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_CAVE_BEARS]Cave Bear:[\LINK][\BOLD] 9 strength. Massive beast.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_CAVE_BEARS_PACK]Cave Bear Pack:[\LINK][\BOLD] 12 strength, is formed like a Wolf Pack. Max strength of 27. Can create a Cave Bear Den, reverting to the Animal Civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_LION_PACK]Lion Pride:[\LINK][\BOLD] 6 strength, is formed like a Wolf Pack. Max strength of 12. Can create a Lion Den, reverting to the Animal Civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_SABRETOOTH]Sabretooth:[\LINK][\BOLD] 6 strength. Available to the Animal civilization, the Sabretooth can spawn on Taiga and Tundra. Model by Warkirby.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_SABRETOOTH_HERO]Sabretooth Pride:[\LINK][\BOLD] 8 strength, is formed like a Wolf Pack. Max strength of 16. Can create a Sabretooth Den, reverting to the Animal Civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_GRIFFON]Griffon:[\LINK][\BOLD] New model by Warkirby.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_GRIFFON_PACK]Griffon Flight:[\LINK][\BOLD] 6 strength, is formed like a Wolf Pack. Max strength of 15. Can create a Griffon Weyr, reverting to the Animal Civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_HIPPOGRIFF]Hippogriff:[\LINK][\BOLD] 4 strength, same strength as the Griffon but is able to carry cargo. Available to the Animal civilization, and can spawn everywhere a normal Griffon does. Model by Warkirby.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_HIPPOGRIFF_FLIGHT]Hippogriff Flight:[\LINK][\BOLD] 6 strength, is formed like a Wolf Pack. Max strength of 15. Can create a Hippogriff Weyr, reverting to the Animal Civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_BEAR_RIDER]Bear Rider:[\LINK][\BOLD] Horse Archer UU. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]8 strength rather than 6, no ranged attack, no defensive strikes. Does not require Archery.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_LUCIAN]Lucian:[\LINK][\BOLD] Lucian gains 'Battle-Hardened'. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]0.5 experience per turn, to a max of 50. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]10% chance to avoid bad lair results. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]10% chance to resist spells. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Allows Heroic Strength/Defense 1.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_DOVIELLO_WEREWOLF]Varulv:[\LINK][\BOLD] New Werewolf hero, available only to Duin. Requires [LINK=TECH_FERAL_BOND]Feral Bond[\LINK], same stats as the Baron. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Can use the [LINK=SPELL_VARULV_SPELL]Feral Howl[\LINK] ability every 15 turns, enraging all recon units on the tile for 10 turnsand allowing them to become Blooded Werewolves if successful in combat.[PARAGRAPH:2][H1]Spells and Civics:[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=SPELL_WILD_HUNT]Call of the Wild:[\LINK][\BOLD] New Worldspell. Grants the caster a new animal for every animal he already controls, with a 20% chance for any promotion possessed by the parent to be passed on to the child.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Create Den:[\BOLD] Wolf Packs, Lion Prides, Griffon Flights, and Bear Packs can now cast this spell, creating an animal lair and reverting to the Animal Civilization.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=CIVIC_WILDCOUNCIL]Council of the Wilds:[\LINK][\BOLD] Doviello-only Membership civic. Doubles animal spawn rate, at the cost of not running Under/Overcouncil.[PARAGRAPH:2][H1]Buildings and Resources:[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=BUILDING_LION_DEN]Lion Den:[\LINK][\BOLD] Available with [LINK=TECH_MINING]Mining[\LINK]. [NEWLINE]Grants a Kindred Spirits promotion to all units built in the city, and allows Lions to spawn.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=BUILDING_BEAR_DEN]Bear Den:[\LINK][\BOLD] Available with [LINK=TECH_SMELTING]Smelting[\LINK]. [NEWLINE]Grants a Kindred Spirits promotion to all units built in the city, and allows Bears to spawn.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=BUILDING_MAMMOTH_DEN]Mammoth Den:[\LINK][\BOLD] Available with [LINK=TECH_HORSEBACK_RIDING]Horseback Riding[\LINK]. [NEWLINE]Grants a Kindred Spirits promotion to all units built in the city, and allows Mammoths to spawn.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=BUILDING_GRIFFIN_WEYR]Griffon Weyr:[\LINK][\BOLD] Available with [LINK=TECH_ANIMAL_HANDLING]Animal Handling[\LINK]. [NEWLINE]Grants a Kindred Spirits promotion to all units built in the city, and allows Griffons to spawn.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=BUILDING_STAG_COPSE]Stag Copse:[\LINK][\BOLD] Available with [LINK=TECH_KNOWLEDGE_OF_THE_ETHER]Knowledge of the Ether[\LINK] [NEWLINE]Grants a Kindred Spirits promotion to all units built in the city, and allows Stags to spawn.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=RESOURCE_BISON]Bison:[\LINK][\BOLD] Northern cows. Doviello gain a small flavourstart bonus for them.

TEXT.English: Movement Costs
TEXT.French: Coût de déplacement
TEXT.Italian: Movement Costs
TEXT.Spanish: Movement Costs

TEXT.English: [H1]Needed Knowledge[\H1][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Every unit has a "Movement" which is the number of standard tiles it can move in one turn. For example, a warrior's movement is 1 and a horseman's movement is 3.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The movement cost is computed for each tile passed through and substracted from the unit movement until it reaches 0.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Movement is a decimal value, but you only see the integer part. For example, if a warrior (movement 1) makes a move that costs him 0.5, his remaining movement becomes 0.5/1, but you still see 1 in the details. If he makes another move costing 0.5, he now has movement 0/1 and can't move anymore on this turn.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Each tile contains a base terrain, a feature and an altitude. These three characteristics can have a movement cost modifier, which translates the difficulty to move through it.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Routes (roads, railroads, trails) can help movement.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Crossing a river costs more movement points.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Some tiles are impassable: mountain (an altitude), volcano (a feature), water (except for naval units of course),... [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Some units ([LINK=PROMOTION_FLYING]flying[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_MONSTROUS_CREATURE]monstrous creature[\LINK]) ignore terrain, feature and altitude costs, route bonuses, river crossing malus and can move through impassable terrain.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Some units have specific movement bonuses : [LINK=PROMOTION_ELF]elves[\LINK] in forests (a feature), [LINK=PROMOTION_DWARF]dwarves[\LINK] on hills (an altitude).[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Some units have specific movement maluses : [LINK=PROMOTION_LIZARDMAN]lizardmen[\LINK] in tundra (a base terrain), [LINK=PROMOTION_ELF]alfar[\LINK] in forests (a feature)[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Some units have specific movement multipliers : [LINK=PROMOTION_WASTELAND_DEFENDER]wasteland defenders[\LINK] in wasteland (a base terrain), [LINK=PROMOTION_WOODSMAN2]units with Woodsman 2[\LINK] in forests (a feature), [LINK=PROMOTION_GUERILLA2]units with Guerilla 2[\LINK] on hills (an altitude).[NEWLINE][H1]Mathematics[\H1]This part will involve a lot of easy maths operations (just the 4 common operators: + - * and /)[H2]Variable template[\H2][ICON_BULLET]Variables who can be true (=1) or false (=0) will have "bool" in their name (as in boolean)[H2]Costs[\H2][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Each base terrain has its movement cost:[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]grass_cost = plain_cost = taiga_cost = 1[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]marsh_cost = glacier_cost = tundra_cost = wasteland_cost = 2[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]desert_cost = 3[NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Each Feature has its movement cost:[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]empty_cost = 1[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]forest_cost = jungle_cost=oasis_cost = 2[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]ancient_forest_cost = scrubs_cost = 3[NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Each Altitude has its movement cost:[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]flat_cost = 1[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]hills_cost = 2[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]peak_cost = 4[NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Each route has its movement bonus:[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]road_bonus = trail_bonus = 2[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]railroad_bonus = 4[H2]Formulas[\H2][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Route multiplier, based on the type of route on the initial tile:[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]ROAD --> route_multiplier = road_bonus + [LINK=TECH_ENGINEERING]bool_has_tech_engineering[\LINK][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]RAILROAD --> route_multiplier = railroad_bonus + 4 * [LINK=TECH_ENGINEERING]bool_has_tech_engineering[\LINK][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]TRAIL --> route_multiplier = trail_bonus * [LINK=PROMOTION_LIZARDMAN]bool_is_lizardman[\LINK][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]We consider terrain, altitude and feature on the arriving tile:[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]move_cost_malus = terrain_cost + altitude_cost + feature_cost - 2[NEWLINE]We consider units bonuses, for example dwarves bonus on hills[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]move_cost = specific_multiplier * (move_cost_malus + specific_malus - specific_bonus)/route_multiplier[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]remaining_move_points = initial_move_points-move_cost[H1]Example[\H1]elven scout moves from grassland/road towards grassland/hills/forest
TEXT.French: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Chaque unité a un "Mouvement" qui est le nombre de cases standard dont elle peut se déplacer par tour. Par exemple, le mouvement d'un guerrier est de 1 et celui d'un cavalier est de 3.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Le coût en mouvement est calculé pour chaque case franchie et soustrait au mouvement total de l'unité jusqu'à atteindre 0.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Le mouvement est une valeur décimale, mais vous ne pouvez en voir que la partie entière. Par exemple, si un guerrier (mouvement 1) fait un déplacement qui lui coûte 0.5, son mouvement restant est de 0.5/1, mais la valeur affichée est toujours 1. S'il effectue un autre mouvement qui lui coûte 0.5 de mouvement, il aura alors 0/1 en mouvement et ne pourra plus se déplacer jusqu'à la fin du tour.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Chaque case est constituée d'un terrain de base, d'un attribut et d'une altitude. Cette combinaison peut influencer le coût en déplacement, qui représente la difficulté à la traverser.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Les Routes (routes, rails, ou sentiers) permettent de faciliter la traversée des cases (donc de réduire le coût en mouvement).[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Traverser une rivière coûte plus de points de mouvement.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Certaines cases sont infranchissables : les montagnes (altitude), un volcan (un attribut), l'eau (sauf pour les unités volantes et navales bien sûr),...[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Certaines unités (par exemple [LINK=PROMOTION_FLYING]volantes[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_MONSTROUS_CREATURE]créature monstrueuse[\LINK]) ignorent les coûts liés au terrain, à l'attribut et à l'altitude, les bonus liés aux routes, les malus liés à la traversée des rivières et peuvent traverser les zones naturellement infranchissables.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Certaines unités ont des bonus de mouvement spécifiques: Par exemple, les [LINK=PROMOTION_ELF]elfes[\LINK] dans les forêts (un attribut), les [LINK=PROMOTION_DWARF]nains[\LINK] sur les collines (une altitude).[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Certaines unités ont des malus de mouvement spécifiques: par exemple, les [LINK=PROMOTION_LIZARDMAN]Hommes-Lézards[\LINK] dans la toundra (un terrain de base), les [LINK=PROMOTION_ELF]alfar[\LINK] dans les forêts (un attribut). [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Certaines unités ont des multiplicateurs de mouvement spécifiques : les [LINK=PROMOTION_WASTELAND_DEFENDER]défenseurs des terres stériles[\LINK] dans les terres stériles (un terrain de base), les unités avec [LINK=PROMOTION_WOODSMAN2]Forestier 2[\LINK] dans les forêts (un attribut), les unités avec [LINK=PROMOTION_GUERILLA2]Guerilla 2[\LINK] sur les collines (une altitude).[NEWLINE][H1]Calculs[\H1]Cette section utilise beaucoup les 4 opérations de base (à savoir + - * / )[H2]Variable template[\H2][ICON_BULLET]Les varibales qui peuvent être vraies (=1) ou fausses (=0) contiennent "bool" dans leurs noms (comme pour booléen)[H2]Coûts[\H2][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Chaque terrain de base a son coût de mouvement propre:[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]prairie_cout = plaine_cout = taïga_cout = 1[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]marais_cost = glacier_cout = toundra_cout = terreperdue_cout = 2[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]désert_cout = 3[NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Chaque attribut a son coût de mouvement propre:[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]vide_cout = 1[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]foret_cout = jungle_cout=oasis_cout = 2[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]foret_ancienne_cout = broussailles_cout = 3[NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Chaque Altitude a son coût de mouvement propre:[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]plat_cout = 1[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]colline_cout = 2[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]montagne_cout = 4[NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Chaque route a son coût de mouvement propre:[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]route_bonus = piste_bonus = 2[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]voieferree_bonus = 4[H2]Formules[\H2][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Multiplicateur de route, basé sur le type de route de la case de départ:[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]ROUTE --> route_multiplicateur = route_bonus + [LINK=TECH_ENGINEERING]bool_possede_tech_ingenierie[\LINK][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]VOIEFERREE --> route_multiplicateur = voieferree_bonus + 4 * [LINK=TECH_ENGINEERING]bool_possede_tech_ingenierie[\LINK][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]PISTE --> route_multiplicateur = piste_bonus * [LINK=PROMOTION_LIZARDMAN]bool_est_un_hommelezard[\LINK][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Considérons le terrain, l'altitude et l'attribut de la case d'arrivée:[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]deplacement_cout_malus = terrain_cout + altitude_cout + attribut_cout - 2[NEWLINE]Prenons en compte les bonus des unités (les nains dans les collines par exemple)[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]deplacement_cout = multiplicateur_specifique * (deplacement_cout_malus + malus_specifique - bonus_specifique) / route_multiplicateury[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]points_de_mouvement_restant = points_de_mouvement_initiaux-deplacement_cout[H1]Exemple[\H1]Éclaireur elfe se déplaçant d'une prairie/route vers une prairie/colline/forêt

TEXT.Italian: Mekara Order - Sluga Units
TEXT.Spanish: Mekara Order - Sluga Units

TEXT.English: [H1]Sluga Units:[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2] The Sluga units are much like Golem units, in that they do not gain any experience on their own (due to not having a unitclass). Unlike the Golems, however, they have no real utility on their own, being mostly useless without a Commander; an [LINK=UNIT_OVERSEER]Overseer[\LINK] for the [LINK=UNIT_SLUGA]Sluga[\LINK] unit, or the [LINK=UNIT_COMBAT_OVERSEER]Combat Overseer[\LINK] for the [LINK=UNIT_BATTLE_SLUGA]Battle Sluga[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_WAR_SLUGA]War Sluga[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_BEHEMOTH_SLUGA]Behemoth[\LINK] units.[PARAGRAPH:2] The [LINK=UNIT_OVERSEER]Overseer[\LINK] improves the [LINK=UNIT_SLUGA]Sluga[\LINK] by improving their workrate dramatically, as well as giving them Build Orders. With the proper promotions, they can also provide terraforming capabilities, as well as the ability to add [ICON_PRODUCTION] to any city the commanded Sluga are stationed in.[PARAGRAPH:2] The [LINK=UNIT_COMBAT_OVERSEER]Combat Overseer[\LINK], on the other hand, serves both as a combat unit, and gives the same capability to the Battle Sluga line of units. The improvements it gives is, among other things, increased Combat Strength, First Strikes, resistance to Collateral Damage, Ranged Attack and both offensive and defensive spells.[PARAGRAPH:2] The Sluga and Battle Sluga are created through a spell castable by Slave units, in cities that have the Mage Guild building, Sluga at Knowledge of the Ether, and Battle Sluga at Alteration. The Sluga can also be built as normal units. War Sluga, meanwhile, are upgraded from Battle Sluga, while the Behemoth unit can only be created through a city spell available at Arcane Lore.
