TEXT.English: [H1]Gladitorial Games:[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2] Gladitorial Games is a temporary building constructed in a city whenever a [LINK=UNIT_SLAVE]Slave[\LINK] unit casts the [LINK=SPELL_ENTER_ARENA]Enter Arena[\LINK] spell. This building gives the city increased culture and happiness while the games continue. The games end when either the unit dies (10% chance each turn), or the unit wins the games (30% change each turn). Should the unit win the games, the player will be given a [LINK=UNIT_GLADIATOR]Gladiator[\LINK] unit to use, which is a fast, powerful, melee unit. If the unit dies, the games end, and nothing else happens.

TEXT.English: [H1]Unit Augmentations:[\H1] [PARAGRAPH:1] The [LINK=UNIT_SHAPER]Shaper[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_HIGHMAGE]High Mage[\LINK] units have an ability which lets them improve other units. This ability works as follows:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]First the mage casts the [LINK=SPELL_RITUAL_PREPARATION]Ritual Preparation[\LINK] spell. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Once the mage has cast this spell, all units in the stack gain the ability to cast the [LINK=SPELL_RITUAL_TARGET_DESIGNATE]Designate Ritual Target[\LINK] spell, which marks it as the target of the ritual, with a promotion.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] After the target has been designated in this way, the mage can cast any of the Aspect spells, which applies a number of effects, chosen at random, to the unit (the actual effects depend on the Aspect chosen).[PARAGRAPH:1][H2]Aspects:[\H2][PARAGRAPH:1]Each of the Aspect spells has a number of mana types associated with it, and each Mana resource in excess of one will add another potential effect. The second and third ranks of the spell sphere promotions will also each add one more effect. Each Aspect has both beneficial and detrimental effects, as well as rare special effects that can be applied. They also each have a 'base' effect, that is applied no matter what. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Aspect of the Beserker [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Mana Types: Body and Force [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Beneficial Effects: Offensive Strength, Heal through Combat, City Attack [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Detrimental Effects: Defensive Strength, Passive Heal Rate, City Defence [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Special Effects: Can Attack Multiple Times and Enhanced Strength [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Base Effects: +2 Attack Strength [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Aspect of the Protector [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Mana Types: Earth and Law [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Beneficial Effects: Passive Heal Rate, Defensive Strength, City and Hill Defence [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Detrimental Effects: Increased Terrain Cost, Withdraw Chance, Offensive Strength [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Special Effects: Resistances, First Strikes and Defensive Strength [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Base Effects: +2 Defence Strength [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Aspect of the Assassin [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Mana Types: Air and Shadow [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Beneficial Effects: First Strikes, Withdrawal Chance, Increased Movement, Heal While Moving [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Detrimental Effects: Defensive Strength, City Attack [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Special Effects: Flying [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Base Effects: -1 Terrain Movement Cost, +5% Withdraw Cance, +1-3 First Strikes [NEWLINE]In addition to this, there are also generic effects that are applied with all Aspects: [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Beneficial Effects: Slightly increased Combat Strength, Extra First Strike Chances [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Detrimental Effects: Slightly decreased Combat Strength, Negative First Strike Chances
TEXT.French: [H1]Unit Augmentations:[\H1] [PARAGRAPH:1] The [LINK=UNIT_SHAPER]Shaper[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_HIGHMAGE]High Mage[\LINK] units have an ability which lets them improve other units. This ability works as follows:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]First the mage casts the [LINK=SPELL_RITUAL_PREPARATION]Ritual Preparation[\LINK] spell. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Once the mage has cast this spell, all units in the stack gain the ability to cast the [LINK=SPELL_RITUAL_TARGET_DESIGNATE]Designate Ritual Target[\LINK] spell, which marks it as the target of the ritual, with a promotion.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] After the target has been designated in this way, the mage can cast any of the Aspect spells, which applies a number of effects, chosen at random, to the unit (the actual effects depend on the Aspect chosen).[PARAGRAPH:1][H2]Aspects:[\H2][PARAGRAPH:1]Each of the Aspect spells has a number of mana types associated with it, and each Mana resource in excess of one will add another potential effect. The second and third ranks of the spell sphere promotions will also each add one more effect. Each Aspect has both beneficial and detrimental effects, as well as rare special effects that can be applied. They also each have a 'base' effect, that is applied no matter what. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Aspect of the Beserker [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Mana Types: Body and Force [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Beneficial Effects: Offensive Strength, Heal through Combat, City Attack [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Detrimental Effects: Defensive Strength, Passive Heal Rate, City Defence [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Special Effects: Can Attack Multiple Times and Enhanced Strength [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Base Effects: +2 Attack Strength [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Aspect of the Protector [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Mana Types: Earth and Law [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Beneficial Effects: Passive Heal Rate, Defensive Strength, City and Hill Defence [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Detrimental Effects: Increased Terrain Cost, Withdraw Chance, Offensive Strength [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Special Effects: Resistances, First Strikes and Defensive Strength [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Base Effects: +2 Defence Strength [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Aspect of the Assassin [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Mana Types: Air and Shadow [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Beneficial Effects: First Strikes, Withdrawal Chance, Increased Movement, Heal While Moving [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Detrimental Effects: Defensive Strength, City Attack [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Special Effects: Flying [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Base Effects: -1 Terrain Movement Cost, +5% Withdraw Cance, +1-3 First Strikes [NEWLINE]In addition to this, there are also generic effects that are applied with all Aspects: [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Beneficial Effects: Slightly increased Combat Strength, Extra First Strike Chances [SPACE][SPACE][SPACE]Detrimental Effects: Slightly decreased Combat Strength, Negative First Strike Chances

TEXT.English: Scions of Patria - Gaining Population
TEXT.French: Scions of Patria - Gaining Population
TEXT.Italian: Scions of Patria - Gaining Population
TEXT.Spanish: Scions of Patria - Gaining Population

TEXT.English: The greatest difference between the Scions and the other civs is how the Scions gain population. As a Fallow civ the Scions don't gain population via food and normal growth. Instead they must lure Awakened from the Bottomless Tomb, create Reborn, or capture cities. [H1]Awakened:[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2] Citizens of long-departed Patria, the Age of Magic's greatest empire, are the the core population of the Scions of Patria. They have been given the Gift, but they still must be brought out of the Bottomless Tomb. Awakened may be "built" in the capital. Structures much like bridges are extended into the Tomb and used to find and ferry the honored dead back into the world. But they are very expensive and inevitably temporary. After a short time they become animate and unalive, like everything in the Tomb, and may no longer be used. Awakened gained this way are expensive. But they honored dead are hard to predict - you'll often be forced to go in after them. The easiest way for the Scions to get population is for an Awakened just walk out of the capital's Bottomless Tomb of it's own free will. But while the Tomb is bottomless an endless army of Awakened won't be coming: They have their own alien amusements there. The longer they stay the less willing they are to leave. The frequency with which Awakened emerge is displayed in the message area and can be increased by the player's actions. Building Shrines to Kylorin, Imperial Cenotaphs or Temples of the Gift, Halls of the Covenant, or the Flesh Studio all attract Awakened. Most luxuries will help lure Awakened. Of special note is the "Patrian Artifacts" resource. Only the Scions player can see these resources, and unlike the other luxuries each resource owned increases the odds. The larger, more bustling the Capital the more will Awakened are to emerge. And when society is explicitly run for the benefit of the Awakened, "Aristocracy", Awakened are more likely to come forth. [H1]Reborn:[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2] Reborn are formerly living inhabitants of Erebus granted the Gift and transformed into undead Scions. There are five ways to gain Reborn. First, Reborn can be created from combat with a priest of the Gift - A Legate, a Doomsayer, or a Doomgiver. The enemy unit is persuaded that unlife among the Scions is preferable to their present meager existence. Second, Reborn can be "built" in a city containing a Cathedral of Rebirth. Third, Pelemoc Goldtongue may persaude the citizens of other civilzations to join Patria Reborn. Fourth, once the Scions have Sorcery and Priesthood a razed city will yield a few Reborn. Finally, the Dark Council generates three Reborn the turn it is established. Capturing cities: Of course anyone can do this. All you need is a bunch of guys with swords. However, the lifestyles of other civs isn't very compatible with the unlifestyle of the Scions. When a city changes hands to or from the Scions most of the population is lost. This reduction isn't as great if the Scions are using the "God King" civic. [H1]Details on Awakened Spawning:[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2] The formula determining the odds an Awakened appear each turn isn't complicated, but it is rather long. The base chance for a Standard-sized world is: Quick: ~9% Normal: ~6% Epic: ~3.5% Marathon: ~3% World Size adjustment: "Population limit" / 40 That limit is 20 for a Duel sized world and goes up to 70 for a Huge world. The world size also sets a cap on Awakened generation: It ranges from 20 for a Duel world to 70 for a Huge one. Additive factors: Capital population / 4 Total buildings: Gift Temples or Cenotaphs * 1 Halls of the Covenant * 2 Shrines to Kylorin / 2 Resources: +0.75 for every Patrian Artifact. +1 for access to Gems, Silk, and Dye. +0.5 for access to Gold, Ivory, Cotton, Incense, Pearls, and Fur. Multipliers: Civic: Aristocracy? Then * 1.4 Game speed - the numbers are linked to game-speed production adjustments. Divide by... Quick: 0.5 Normal: 0.75 Epic: 1.125 Marathon: 1.5 Game turn. Every turn it's a little harder by... Quick: 0.5% Normal: 0.25% Epic: 0.165% Marathon: 0.125% Ai mod: The AI gets a 20% bonus. Leader: Korrina has a 25% penalty.

After a short time they become animate and unalive, like everything in the Tomb, and may no longer be used. Awakened gained this way are expensive. But they honored dead are hard to predict - you'll often be forced to go in after them. The easiest way for the Scions to get population is for an Awakened just walk out of the capital's Bottomless Tomb of it's own free will. But while the Tomb is bottomless an endless army of Awakened won't be coming: They have their own alien amusements there. The longer they stay the less willing they are to leave. The frequency with which Awakened emerge is displayed in the message area and can be increased by the player's actions. Building Shrines to Kylorin, Imperial Cenotaphs or Temples of the Gift, Halls of the Covenant, or the Flesh Studio all attract Awakened. Most luxuries will help lure Awakened. Of special note is the "Patrian Artifacts" resource. Only the Scions player can see these resources, and unlike the other luxuries each resource owned increases the odds. The larger, more bustling the Capital the more will Awakened are to emerge. And when society is explicitly run for the benefit of the Awakened, "Aristocracy", Awakened are more likely to come forth. [H1]Reborn:[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2] Reborn are formerly living inhabitants of Erebus granted the Gift and transformed into undead Scions. There are five ways to gain Reborn. First, Reborn can be created from combat with a priest of the Gift - A Legate, a Doomsayer, or a Doomgiver. The enemy unit is persuaded that unlife among the Scions is preferable to their present meager existence. Second, Reborn can be "built" in a city containing a Cathedral of Rebirth. Third, Pelemoc Goldtongue may persaude the citizens of other civilzations to join Patria Reborn. Fourth, once the Scions have Sorcery and Priesthood a razed city will yield a few Reborn. Finally, the Dark Council generates three Reborn the turn it is established. Capturing cities: Of course anyone can do this. All you need is a bunch of guys with swords. However, the lifestyles of other civs isn't very compatible with the unlifestyle of the Scions. When a city changes hands to or from the Scions most of the population is lost. This reduction isn't as great if the Scions are using the "God King" civic. [H1]Details on Awakened Spawning:[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2] The formula determining the odds an Awakened appear each turn isn't complicated, but it is rather long. The base chance for a Standard-sized world is: Quick: ~9% Normal: ~6% Epic: ~3.5% Marathon: ~3% World Size adjustment: "Population limit" / 40 That limit is 20 for a Duel sized world and goes up to 70 for a Huge world. The world size also sets a cap on Awakened generation: It ranges from 20 for a Duel world to 70 for a Huge one. Additive factors: Capital population / 4 Total buildings: Gift Temples or Cenotaphs * 1 Halls of the Covenant * 2 Shrines to Kylorin / 2 Resources: +0.75 for every Patrian Artifact. +1 for access to Gems, Silk, and Dye. +0.5 for access to Gold, Ivory, Cotton, Incense, Pearls, and Fur. Multipliers: Civic: Aristocracy? Then * 1.4 Game speed - the numbers are linked to game-speed production adjustments. Divide by... Quick: 0.5 Normal: 0.75 Epic: 1.125 Marathon: 1.5 Game turn. Every turn it's a little harder by... Quick: 0.5% Normal: 0.25% Epic: 0.165% Marathon: 0.125% Ai mod: The AI gets a 20% bonus. Leader: Korrina has a 25% penalty.

TEXT.English: Scions of Patria - The Dark Council
TEXT.French: Scions of Patria - The Dark Council
TEXT.German: Scionen von Patria - Das Dunkle Konzil
TEXT.Italian: Scions of Patria - The Dark Council
TEXT.Spanish: Scions of Patria - The Dark Council

TEXT.English: [H1]The Councilors[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Patria was blessed with many men and women of enormous accomplishment. Patria Rebon shares in that blessing and the Age of Magic's greatest Princes and Poets, Warriors and Merchants, daily walk its streets. The Emperor has appointed four such persons special roles in the Age of Rebirth. Not just undead but unconquerable, if destroyed they always pay heed to the Emperor's call and re-emerge from the great Tomb. Each has his or her special role, and together they lead the Scions Dark Council.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Alcinus - The Mad Thaumaturge[\BOLD] Emerges from the Tomb with Knowledge of the Ether. He founds the essential Thaumaturge's Keep in any city outside the capital (the Apparat refuses to allow it near the Palace) and plays an important part in the Empire's Rituals. Subject to periodic bouts of violent madness, the great mage occasionally turns against his own people. At that point there is nothing that may be done but running him down. A new death returns him to the Emperor. Though even that's not certain. Should he go rogue and join a rival civilization the Scions specially trained wizard-hunters - the Emperor's Daggers - will seek him out.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Themoch, the Silent Watcher[\BOLD] - Unseen but far from sightless, as patient as the grave, at "Tracking" Themoch rides forth, the perfect sentry and spy.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Pelemoc Goldtongue[\BOLD] - He appears most often as a well-off merchant, but will appear in other guises if they serve his need. Pelemoc is no mage, but he bends minds and scatters armies with his mastery of money, with his silver-tongue.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Melante, the Artful Governor[\BOLD] - Head of the Dark Council, Melante is knows as much of the ways of men as Pelemoc, and is just as deft with words. But where he persuades, she rules. Any city with Melante as it's governor will be markedly more productive.[PARAGRAPH:2][H1]The Dark Council[\H1][PARAGRAPH:1]Once all four leading Councilors are together in a city outside the capital Melante may found the Dark Council, casting the Scions of Patria World Spell. The Dark Council world-wonder is created. The Dark Council grants three Reborn, and it's ongoing activities foster both trade in Scions cities and discontent among their enemies.

TEXT.English: Scions of Patria - The Haunted Lands
TEXT.French: Scions of Patria - The Haunted Lands
TEXT.Italian: Scions of Patria - The Haunted Lands
TEXT.Spanish: Scions of Patria - The Haunted Lands

TEXT.English: [H1]The Haunted Lands[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]It is the nature of the world that everything is itself. This may seem a truism, but it does not hold in the Haunted Lands. The Haunted Lands join everything together, in the Haunted Lands things *blur*. Notably the line between death and life. There life, of a sort, is found in death and death, of a sort, is found in life.[PARAGRAPH:1]Eating anything grown within the Haunted Lands is very difficult. The grain may scream when harvested and make bread that crumbles into something like bone meal when baked. Its beer could taste and smell of nightmares. Cattle tend to be stillborn, which makes it all the more disturbing as the herds continue to grow.[PARAGRAPH:1]Nevertheless there is much wealth to be found in the Haunted Lands for the brave of heart and strong of stomach. Examples: A tree with branches that when aged and dried taste of nectar and honey, after being killed and cooked, of course. A stream lined with trainable, watchful stones. A pit full of knowledgeable darkness.[PARAGRAPH:2]Use Haunted Lands to defend Patria Reborn or spoil the territories of your enemies. The Haunted Lands are not well suited to the living.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Undead have a natural affinity to the Haunted Lands. Their senses are sharpened, their arms strong. The Haunted Lands are also a source of many wonders... often grotesque or terrible. The useful ones can be kept or traded so others may appreciate the Gift. The useless ones - and there are many - can be a burden to any nearby living land. The Haunted Lands will foster Unhealth in nearby cities.[PARAGRAPH:1]Perhaps most disturbing, at least to those who haven't accepted the Emperor's Gift, is that those bearing wounds in the Haunted Lands do not always heal true. The substance of the Haunted Lands, or the lack thereof, enters their flesh. They become undead. Some carry on afterward, cleaving to their old gods and loyalties. Some go strange, eventually raising their hand - or whatever's left - against all others.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ghostwalkers can undergo a different transformation with the Haunted Lands. They share out part of their own substance and humanity to the surrounding terrain, drinking from even more of the territory's inhuman nature. They become Haunts. Insubstantial, but hardly less terrible for that. Whip-fast, hard to see until it's right on top of you, a Haunt's airy frame can't take your head off, but this is hardly a comfort when it roars through your army and sinks it's claws into your skull.[PARAGRAPH:2][H1]Mending Nature[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Three Scion units create Haunted Lands.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Ghostwalkers[\BOLD] - With "Necromancy" a Ghostwalker may spend six turns creating a Haunted Lands. tile.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Reaching Creepers[\BOLD] - Any Creeper surviving a combat becomes swollen with blood and can put down roots and blossom into a Haunted Land tile. At the prompting of some uncanny cycle Creepers are spontaneously spawned within the Haunted Lands. Nature Mana perverted to Scion use increases the number of Creepers spawned, as does the number of Ghostwalkers and Redactors present in Erebus.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Redactors[\BOLD] - As soon as their available Redactors can create Haunted Lands. They transform not only their own tile, but those around them as well. The life within a forest or jungle may hold out for a time, but will succumb eventually.[PARAGRAPH:1]The mere existence of Ghostwalkers, Haunts, Redactors and the Black Lady allow Haunted Lands to spontaneously wrest themselves from non-existence. The more life, the more likely the transformation: Wooded areas are the most likely to change, Deserts the least. Haunts exert more influence than Ghostwalkers, and Redactors more than Haunts. The Black Lady doubles the odds of Haunted Lands appearing in this manner, and each node of Nature Mana has a similar if less dramatic influence.

The more life, the more likely the transformation: Wooded areas are the most likely to change, Deserts the least. Haunts exert more influence than Ghostwalkers, and Redactors more than Haunts. The Black Lady doubles the odds of Haunted Lands appearing in this manner, and each node of Nature Mana has a similar if less dramatic influence.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]The Haunted Lands[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]It is the nature of the world that everything is itself. This may seem a truism, but it does not hold in the Haunted Lands. The Haunted Lands join everything together, in the Haunted Lands things *blur*. Notably the line between death and life. There life, of a sort, is found in death and death, of a sort, is found in life.[PARAGRAPH:1]Eating anything grown within the Haunted Lands is very difficult. The grain may scream when harvested and make bread that crumbles into something like bone meal when baked. Its beer could taste and smell of nightmares. Cattle tend to be stillborn, which makes it all the more disturbing as the herds continue to grow.[PARAGRAPH:1]Nevertheless there is much wealth to be found in the Haunted Lands for the brave of heart and strong of stomach. Examples: A tree with branches that when aged and dried taste of nectar and honey, after being killed and cooked, of course. A stream lined with trainable, watchful stones. A pit full of knowledgeable darkness.[PARAGRAPH:2]Use Haunted Lands to defend Patria Reborn or spoil the territories of your enemies. The Haunted Lands are not well suited to the living.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Undead have a natural affinity to the Haunted Lands. Their senses are sharpened, their arms strong. The Haunted Lands are also a source of many wonders... often grotesque or terrible. The useful ones can be kept or traded so others may appreciate the Gift. The useless ones - and there are many - can be a burden to any nearby living land. The Haunted Lands will foster Unhealth in nearby cities.[PARAGRAPH:1]Perhaps most disturbing, at least to those who haven't accepted the Emperor's Gift, is that those bearing wounds in the Haunted Lands do not always heal true. The substance of the Haunted Lands, or the lack thereof, enters their flesh. They become undead. Some carry on afterward, cleaving to their old gods and loyalties. Some go strange, eventually raising their hand - or whatever's left - against all others.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ghostwalkers can undergo a different transformation with the Haunted Lands. They share out part of their own substance and humanity to the surrounding terrain, drinking from even more of the territory's inhuman nature. They become Haunts. Insubstantial, but hardly less terrible for that. Whip-fast, hard to see until it's right on top of you, a Haunt's airy frame can't take your head off, but this is hardly a comfort when it roars through your army and sinks it's claws into your skull.[PARAGRAPH:2][H1]Mending Nature[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Three Scion units create Haunted Lands.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Ghostwalkers[\BOLD] - With "Necromancy" a Ghostwalker may spend six turns creating a Haunted Lands. tile.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Reaching Creepers[\BOLD] - Any Creeper surviving a combat becomes swollen with blood and can put down roots and blossom into a Haunted Land tile. At the prompting of some uncanny cycle Creepers are spontaneously spawned within the Haunted Lands. Nature Mana perverted to Scion use increases the number of Creepers spawned, as does the number of Ghostwalkers and Redactors present in Erebus.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Redactors[\BOLD] - As soon as their available Redactors can create Haunted Lands. They transform not only their own tile, but those around them as well. The life within a forest or jungle may hold out for a time, but will succumb eventually.[PARAGRAPH:1]The mere existence of Ghostwalkers, Haunts, Redactors and the Black Lady allow Haunted Lands to spontaneously wrest themselves from non-existence. The more life, the more likely the transformation: Wooded areas are the most likely to change, Deserts the least. Haunts exert more influence than Ghostwalkers, and Redactors more than Haunts. The Black Lady doubles the odds of Haunted Lands appearing in this manner, and each node of Nature Mana has a similar if less dramatic influence.

TEXT.English: Deep jungle, Wetlands and Swamps
TEXT.French: Deep jungle, Wetlands and Swamps
TEXT.Italian: Deep jungle, Wetlands and Swamps
TEXT.Spanish: Deep jungle, Wetlands and Swamps

TEXT.English: The Lizardman civilizations favour specific terrain types and gain unique benefits from them. Some of these terrain/feature types will only be found in their territory and will spread naturally over time. These are Deep Jungle (feature), Wetlands (terrain) and Swamp (improvement).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Deep Jungle feature replaces any natural jungle within a lizardman civilization's borders. It will revert to normal jungle once outside those borders. It does not convey the normal health and food penalties typically associated with jungle - in fact, it acts in a way very similar to a forest (providing bonus production and health). The only civilizations that will ever be able to benefit from this however are the Lizardmen. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Wetlands are a new base-terrain type which behave exactly like grassland, unless they are within Lizardman borders. If they are within such borders, any forest feature on a wetland tile will eventually convert to a deep jungle. Any wetland tile that has no bonus resource and no improvements on it may occasionally gain the swamp improvement for free and/or have deep jungle appear on it. Any grassland tile may become a wetland tile over time, though the process is much quicker in tiles that border rivers. Finally, wetland tiles allow units of the "Lizardkin" race to move faster through them.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Swamp improvement is an unpillagable, negative improvement for races without the Swampdwelling technology. For races with this technology however, it provides a number of benefits. Primarily, it provides additional food, with several techs that boost the food yield further. Additionally, it can provide commerce when combined with a trail. It can be created in tiles containing deep jungle, allowing it to also provide production. Swamps appear naturally in wetland tiles over time, or can be artificially created using the "Spring" spell on a wetland tile. They can be removed by using the "Scorch" spell (which reverts the tile back to basic grassland). They cannot exist in any tile other than wetland and so are also destroyed by conversion to hell-terrain. You cannot build any other improvement on top of a swamp, but it can co-exist with forest/jungle features.

TEXT.German: Die Echsenmenschen bevorzugen bestimmtes Terrain und erhalten einzigartige Boni auf ihnen. Einige dieser Geländearten und Ressourcen wird man nur auf ihrem Gebiet finden und verbreiten sich nach einiger Zeit von selbst. Das sind Tiefer Dschungel (Eigenschaft), Feuchtgebiet (Terrain) und Sumpf (Ausbau).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Die Tiefe Dschungel Eigenschaft ersetzt alle natürlichen Dschungel innerhalb des Echsenmenschengebietes. Sie wird sich erst außerhalb deren Grenzen wieder durch normalen Dschungel zurückumwandeln. Tiefer Dschungel trägt nicht die üblicherweise mit Dschungel verknüpften Abzüge auf Gesundheit und Nahrung. Eigentlich verhält er sich diesbezüglich ähnlich wie Wald. Doch die einzigen Zivilisationen, die von ihm profitieren können, sind die der Echsenmenschen. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Feuchtgebiete sind neue Flachland-Geländearten, die sich genau wie Grasland verhalten, solange sie innerhalb der Gebiete der Echsenmenschen zu finden sind. Wenn sie in sich diesen Grenzen befinden, kann sich ein Wald, der auf einem Feuchtgebiet zu finden ist, unter Umständen zu einem Tiefen Dschungel werden. Jedes Feuchtgebiet, das keine Bonusressource und keine Ausbauten beinhaltet, erhält gelegentlich die Sumpfanbau Ausbauung oder eine Umwandlung zu Tiefem Dschungel. Jedes Graslandfeld kann ein Feuchtgebietfeld werden, wobei natürlich diese Umwandlung schneller bei an Flüssen gelegenen Feldern schneller vonstatten gehen kann. Außerdem kommen alle Echsenmenschen Einheiten auf Feuchtgebiet schneller voran.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Sumpfausbau ist für Rassen ohne ohne den Sumpfbau-Fortschritt unplünderbare, negative Ausbauten. Für die anderen erzeugt er jedoch eine Reihe von interessanten Vorteilen. Zu Beginn liefert der Sumpfausbau zusätzliche Nahrung, deren Ertrag durch zusätzliche Technologien noch erhöht werden kann. Durch einen Sumpfpfad kann auch Geld erzeugt werden. Sumpfausbau kann auf Feldern mit Tiefem Dschungel angelegt werden, so daß auch Produktion gesteigert werden. Sümpfe erscheinen natürlicherweise nach einiger Zeit in. Die Echsenmenschen bevorzugen bestimmtes Terrain und erhalten einzigartige Boni auf ihnen. Einige dieser Geländearten und Ressourcen wird man nur auf ihrem Gebiet finden und verbreiten sich nach einiger Zeit von selbst. Das sind Tiefer Dschungel (Eigenschaft), Feuchtgebiet (Terrain) und Sumpf (Ausbau).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Die Tiefe Dschungel Eigenschaft ersetzt alle natürlichen Dschungel innerhalb des Echsenmenschengebietes. Sie wird sich erst außerhalb deren Gr Feuchtgebieten oder können künstlich durch den "Quelle"-Zauber angelegt werden. Sie können durch den "Verbrennen"-Zauber trockengelegt werden (Grasland ensteht). Sie gibt es nur auf Feuchtgebietfeldern und werden durch die Umwandlung zu Höllengebiet zerstört. Außer Sumpf kann man keine andere Bewirtschaftung auf diesem Terrain erzeugen, er kann aber sehr wohl mit Dschungel oder Wald Eigenschaften gemeinsam vorliegen.

TEXT.English: Elohim - Keepers of Sacred Places
TEXT.French: Elohim - Keepers of Sacred Places
TEXT.Italian: Elohim - Keepers of Sacred Places
TEXT.Spanish: Elohim - Keepers of Sacred Places

TEXT.English: [H1]Keepers of Sacred Places[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]The Elohim are the Keepers of Sacred Places. As such, for each of the unique features they have within their borders, they get a different blessing. To assist them with this endeavor, they will start the game by knowing the location of all unique features on the map. The following is a list of what each unique feature provides:[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_AIFON_ISLE]Aifon Isle[\LINK] - Keepers of Danalin's Sorrow: +15% [ICON_FOOD] and [ICON_COMMERCE] from [ICON_TRADE]. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_BAIR_OF_LACUNA]Bair of Lacuna[\LINK] - Keepers of the Undying's Lair: +20% Ritual Production in All Cities. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_BRADELINES_WELL]Bradeline's Well[\LINK] - [LINK=PROMOTION_KEEPERS_WELL]Keepers of the Underworld's Gate[\LINK]: Disciple and Arcane units gain +30% vs Demon. If it could be purified, however... [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_BROKEN_SEPULCHER]Broken Sepulcher[\LINK] - [LINK=PROMOTION_KEEPERS_SEPULCHER]Keepers of Death's Shattered Jail[\LINK]: All combat units gain +25% Resistance to Death Damage, and -25% to Enemy Withdrawal Chance. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_CLIFFS_OF_TALI]Cliffs of Kelle[\LINK] - [LINK=PROMOTION_KEEPERS_TALI]Keepers of Storm's Crag[\LINK]: Commander, Recon, and Rogue units gain +25% chance to avoid bad lair results and +25% withdrawal chance. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_CLOCKWORK_TOWER]Clockwork City[\LINK] - [LINK=PROMOTION_KEEPERS_CLOCKWORK]Keepers of the Mechanical Marvel[\LINK]: Siege units recieve +1 Range, +3 Ranged Strength, +15% Ranged Damage Limit, and Magic Immunity. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_DRAGON_BONES]Dragon Bones[\LINK] - [LINK=PROMOTION_KEEPERS_BONES]Keepers of the Giant Skull[\LINK]: Melee and Defensive Melee Units gain +25% vs Animal and Beast Units, and capture defeated Beast Units. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FOXFORD]Foxford[\LINK] - [LINK=PROMOTION_KEEPERS_FOXFORD]Keepers of the Howling Hamlet[\LINK]: Animal, Beast, and Melee Units get +2 First Strike Chances and +25% vs Animal, Beast, Melee, and Defensive Melee Units. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GUARDIAN]Guardian of the Pristin Pass[\LINK] - Keepers of Stone Guardians: Free [LINK=BUILDING_PRISTIN_GUARDIAN]Pristin Guardian Building[\LINK] in Every City (+25% Defense, -25% Damage From Bombardment) and all non-animal combat units gain [LINK=PROMOTION_LIGHTNING_RESISTANCE]Resist Lightning[\LINK]. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LETUM_FRIGUS]Letum Frigus[\LINK] - Keepers of Winter's End: +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] from [LINK=TERRAIN_TAIGA]Taiga[\LINK], +1 [ICON_FOOD] from [LINK=TERRAIN_TUNDRA]Tundra[\LINK], and all non-animal combat units gain [LINK=PROMOTION_COLD_RESISTANCE]Resist Cold[\LINK]. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_MAELSTROM]Maelstrom[\LINK] - [LINK=PROMOTION_KEEPERS_MAELSTROM]Keepers of the Maelstrom[\LINK]: All Naval and Rogue Units gain +1 movement. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_MIRROR_OF_HEAVEN]Mirror of Heaven[\LINK] - [LINK=PROMOTION_KEEPERS_MIRROR]Keepers of the Heavenly Mirror[\LINK]: +1 [ICON_FOOD] and [ICON_COMMERCE] from [LINK=FEATURE_OASIS]Oasis[\LINK]. Commander, Disciple, and Recon Units gain +1 Visibility Range and Perception. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_MOUNT_KALSHEKK]Mount Kalshekk[\LINK] - Keepers of Earth's Fiery Heart: +1 [ICON_FOOD], [ICON_PRODUCTION], and [ICON_COMMERCE] from Jungle. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_ODIOS_PRISON]Odio's Prison[\LINK] - Keepers of Contained Wrath: All units gain +1 XP from combat. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_POOL_OF_TEARS]Pool of Tears[\LINK] - Keepers of the Waters of Birth: All cities gain +4 [ICON_HEALTHY], and all non-animal combat units gain [LINK=PROMOTION_RESIST_POISON]Poison Resistance[\LINK]. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_PYRE_OF_THE_SERAPHIC]Pyre of the Seraphic[\LINK] - Keepers of the Eternal Fire: +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] and [ICON_COMMERCE] from [LINK=TERRAIN_BURNING_SANDS]burning sands[\LINK], and all non-animal combat units gain [LINK=PROMOTION_FIRE_RESISTANCE]Resist Fire[\LINK]. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_REMNANTS_OF_PATRIA]Remnants of Patria[\LINK] - Keepers of Mankind's Ruins: -20% Maintenance Costs from Distance to Palace. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_RING_OF_CARCER]Ring of Carcer[\LINK] - [LINK=PROMOTION_KEEPERS_CARCER]Keepers of the Frozen Passion[\LINK]: +15% XP Gain for all units. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_RINWELL]Rinwell Isle[\LINK] - [LINK=PROMOTION_KEEPERS_RINWELL]Keepers of the Dead Island[\LINK]: +1 [ICON_FOOD] on [LINK=TERRAIN_MARSH]marsh[\LINK] and [LINK=TERRAIN_SHALLOWS]shallows[\LINK], all combat units lose amphibious assault penalties, and gain +25% Resistance to Death Damage. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_SEVEN_PINES]Seven Pines[\LINK] - Keepers of the Lost Peace: +10% [ICON_CULTURE] and [ICON_RESEARCH] when at peace. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_SIRONAS_BEACON]Sirona's Beacon[\LINK] - [LINK=PROMOTION_KEEPERS_SIRONA]Keepers of Mercy's Light[\LINK]: [LINK=AFFINITY_KEEPERS_SIRONA]Each Spirit Mana[\LINK] gives Disciple Units +5% Heal Rate, +0.5% XP Rate, +0.5 Holy Damage, and +10% Resistance to Unholy Damage. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_STANDING_STONES]Standing Stones[\LINK] - Keepers of Earth's Memento: +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] on Plots with 3 [ICON_PRODUCTION]. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_TOMB_OF_SUCELLUS]Tomb of Sucellus[\LINK] - [LINK=PROMOTION_KEEPERS_SUCELLUS]Keepers of Nature's Grave[\LINK]: All units gain +10% Heal Rate and +5% Healing After Combat. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_TOWER_OF_EYES]Tower of Eyes[\LINK] - [LINK=PROMOTION_KEEPERS_EYES]Keepers of the Madman's Cell[\LINK]: All combat units gain [LINK=PROMOTION_MAGIC_RESISTANCE]Resist Magic[\LINK], and all units are immune to capture. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_WELL_OF_SOULS]Well of Souls[\LINK] - [LINK=PROMOTION_KEEPERS_SOUL]Keepers of the Barred Procession[\LINK]: +1 [ICON_FOOD], [ICON_PRODUCTION], and [ICON_COMMERCE] on [LINK=TERRAIN_WASTELAND]wasteland[\LINK], and combat units gain +20% vs Undead. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_YGGDRASIL]Yggdrasil[\LINK] - Keepers of the Sacred Tree: +1 [ICON_FOOD] on Plots with 3 [ICON_FOOD].[PARAGRAPH:2]With the Magister Ashes module enabled, the following Sacred Places and blessings are possible: [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_ABADDONS_PIT]Abbadon's Pit[\LINK] - [LINK=PROMOTION_KEEPERS_ABADDON]Keepers of the Locust's Jail[\LINK]: Disciple, Defensive Melee, and Worker units gain double fortification bonus, +1 Visibility Range and Perception. +1 [ICON_FOOD], [ICON_PRODUCTION] and [ICON_COMMERCE] on [LINK=TERRAIN_BROKEN_LANDS]Broken Lands[\LINK] and [LINK=TERRAIN_FIELDS_OF_PERDITION]Fields of Perdition[\LINK]. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_BADBS_BLIZZARD]Blizzard's Castle[\LINK] - Keepers of the Eternal Blizzard: Arcane and Rogue units gain [LINK=PROMOTION_COLD_STRENGTH]+1 Cold Strength[\LINK]. [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GRAVE_OF_ASMODAY]Grave of Asmoday[\LINK] - [LINK=PROMOTION_KEEPERS_ASMODAY]Keepers of the Lord of Dust's Tomb[\LINK]: Animal, Beast, Melee, Naval, and Siege units gain +2 Collateral Damage Targets and +20% Collateral Damage Limit. Whispers beckon... [ICON_BULLET][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_WHISPERING_WOOD]Whispering Woods[\LINK] - [LINK=PROMOTION_KEEPERS_WHISPERING]Keepers of the Veil of Shadows[\LINK]: Arcane, Commander, Rogue, and Worker units gain +3 Perception and Ignore Terrain Movement Costs.[PARAGRAPH:2]Beware, however: Should the watchers against corruption themselves fall to its seductive power, their blessings may falter, or twist...
